title: On Sensuality
body:
> Like the river to oblivion, Lethe, 
 aimless and unmindful to 
 the words I have misplaced 
 upon my return, careless like an 
 unmanned hammock by the sea; 
 perhaps this is not a return 
 but where I’ve crept all along 
 like a body that sneezed out 
 a soul that dreamt of fleeing loudly; 
 maybe this is where I kiss next 
 the one with violent hair, gorgeous 
 babbler of things nonsensically 
 appropriate, *so so so* she’ll say 
 *just know why I call you Sisyphus 
 because you rise and fall like the sun 
 deserving all six of my kisses*, and 
 yes, in those moments there is 
 tension, like great muscles flexing 
 out of apprehension 
 of something immediate, some 
 Charybdis or Scylla churning 
 out an inviting gesture of the eye 
 a look that could only mean 
 *come and we will meet as lovers 
 upon the plains of oblivion*; and 
 I hear her in my mind, the 
 imaginary preaching: 
 *I will count the strands of your 
 hair which are the days of your 
 calendar, beautiful boy*.

title: 20个在加密熊市中生存的技巧
body:
以下是 [@thedefiedge](https://twitter.com/thedefiedge) 在向币圈老韭菜征集有关如何在熊市中生存的建议后整理的观点，以帮助您建立自己的投资理论。

[https://twitter.com/thedefiedge/status/1529121445757919232](https://twitter.com/thedefiedge/status/1529121445757919232)

[https://twitter.com/thedefiedge/status/1527272894719479808](https://twitter.com/thedefiedge/status/1527272894719479808)

### 1/ 提高技能

[@Darrenlautf](https://twitter.com/Darrenlautf) 建议学习编码，他经营着一家求职网站，数据显示有90%的招聘需求是面向开发人员的。 
  
 学习和建设 - 不要只是坐等接下来的几年（坐等牛市）。现在是2022年，您可以在线免费的学习。

[https://twitter.com/Darrenlautf/status/1527531654427815938](https://twitter.com/Darrenlautf/status/1527531654427815938)

### 2/ 不要与2018年直接比较

2018年大多数项目都是骗局或者处于白皮书阶段，现在的协议更加成熟。当前DeFi 中锁定了超过 1400 亿美元，并且一些协议正在产生数百万美元。

[https://twitter.com/CryptoJake420/status/1527280750965366786](https://twitter.com/CryptoJake420/status/1527280750965366786)

### 3/ 为金融危机做好准备

大多数人都很年轻，从未经历过如此糟糕的宏观环境，通货膨胀处于 40 年来的最高点

* 买比特币
* 秘钥安全
* 忽略市场价格
* 停止在垃圾项目上赌博
* 摆脱杠杆
* 工作
* 定投
* 为金融危机做准备
* 照顾好家人
* 使用任何业余时间学习技能

[https://twitter.com/TheGuySwann/status/1527339390514581513](https://twitter.com/TheGuySwann/status/1527339390514581513)

### 4/ 大多数币价将永远不会破前高

项目资金耗尽，开发人员失去信心后退场。或者新的项目出现并取代你的热度，要知道大多币价从未恢复其前高。 
  
 不要以为一切都会回来，有些事情会永久沉寂，应该专注于建立人们真正想要的和真正有价值的事情上。

[https://twitter.com/nic__carter/status/1527360963183525891](https://twitter.com/nic__carter/status/1527360963183525891)

### 5/ 也许你不应该卖掉你的币

这也取决于你投资的项目，我一直持有 $BNB $VET 经历了2018年的寒冬，最终起飞 
  
 警告：沉默成本偏见、幸存者偏见、小道消息、幻想起飞 
  
 坚持持有有价值的组合，然后忘记它们笃定未来，重新开始，在熊市慢慢研究和积累

[https://twitter.com/0xOGDegen/status/1527276167115546625](https://twitter.com/0xOGDegen/status/1527276167115546625)

### 6/ 不要信仰（不断调整你的判断）

每一个周期都有它的宠儿 
 • 2017: EOS, NEO, XRP 
 • 2020: DeFi 1.0 Protocols 
  
 他们在主要周期中表现良好，但无法保持后来的周期中的动力。 
  
 元宇宙的玩法会发生变化，或者他们会创新。

[https://twitter.com/TraderDefi/status/1527406610858921984](https://twitter.com/TraderDefi/status/1527406610858921984)

### 7/ 关注项目方

谁仍在迭代他们的产品？ 
 谁仍在与社区互动？ 
  
 韭菜们应该把精力花在那些在熊市仍然在努力工作的项目上

[https://twitter.com/MrBenLilly/status/1527446869206618112](https://twitter.com/MrBenLilly/status/1527446869206618112)

### 8/ 投资你的健康和友谊

你可能在熊市损失了很多，但还有什么事情比健康和友谊更重要？ 
  
 要重视非加密社区的友谊，这会让你保持理智，保持身心健康，这将是你绝望时需要的

[https://twitter.com/MarkBeylin/status/1527361777675055114](https://twitter.com/MarkBeylin/status/1527361777675055114)

### 9/ 不要追求过高的收益率

我们倾向于高估来自通胀代币的收益率，如果它的价值跌了95%，那么即使200%的年化收益又有什么用。

[https://twitter.com/ProtocolUpdate/status/1527365094790705158](https://twitter.com/ProtocolUpdate/status/1527365094790705158)

### 10/ 改善你的投资公式

不管你是否意识到，你脑子里都有一个投资算法。 
  
 坐下来反思。写下你的规则和原则。 
  
 做真实的自己，否则你会在下一个周期犯同样的错误。 
  
 活下来更重要

[https://twitter.com/Tradermayne/status/1527436636190937088](https://twitter.com/Tradermayne/status/1527436636190937088)

### 11/ 生存优先

尽一切可能活下来 
  
 降低支出（个人和企业） 
  
 改造/重组

[https://twitter.com/danheld/status/1527337849561174021](https://twitter.com/danheld/status/1527337849561174021)

### 12/ 不急于抄底

底部需要一段时间才能形成，有人建议等待一年后再买入加密资产。 
  
 也有人建议不要尝试抄底，而是通过定投摊平成本

[https://twitter.com/cryptorabbitt/status/1527273501534654464](https://twitter.com/cryptorabbitt/status/1527273501534654464)

### 13/ 等待新的加密世界（或元宇宙）

在下一个周期到来时可能现在最有价值的协议都不复存在了 
 要时刻保持对市场的热情和兴趣，这样将不会错过 
 早期参与者时获利最多的，机遇是在熊市中产生的

[https://twitter.com/TraderDefi/status/1527368210642702336](https://twitter.com/TraderDefi/status/1527368210642702336)

### 14/ 不要与美联储抗争（看懂经济周期）

目前，加密货币与美联储的货币政策强相关。

* 牛市时美联储疯狂印钱释放流动性
* 熊市时美联储加息锁表收缩流动性

请注意美联储如何打击通货膨胀和控制货币供应。

不要与之抗争。

[https://twitter.com/producer_fred/status/1527279159977734144](https://twitter.com/producer_fred/status/1527279159977734144)

### 15/ 寻找爱好

要耐心等待。 
  
 同时，出去享受生活。 
  
 出去旅行（身心愉悦）是在熊市期间获得的最好的投资回报率

[https://twitter.com/rogenecoin/status/1527306776537747456](https://twitter.com/rogenecoin/status/1527306776537747456)

### 16/ 建立额外的收入来源

1. 保持低仓位，不要太激进 
2. 有一个不相关的收入来源
3. 蓝筹项目在价格疲软时要坚定信念
4. 持续学习

[https://twitter.com/probablymato/status/1527301734250340357](https://twitter.com/probablymato/status/1527301734250340357)

### 17/ 不要尝试击败市场

一定有人通过炒合约和炒短线来频繁交易，不要这么做，这很容易亏钱 
  
 大多数人应该持续定投蓝筹项目

[https://twitter.com/jasonczmeng/status/1527285855643045889](https://twitter.com/jasonczmeng/status/1527285855643045889)

### 18/ 价值投资

很难预测你抄底的认为很棒的项目能否价格恢复前高，大多数人应该坚持购买 $BTC $ETH 这些龙头项目。 
  
 市场既需要冲动也需要重拾信心，但是这很正常不要紧张 
  
 要进行学习和研究来提高认知

[https://twitter.com/mudnasty2/status/1527673460037627905](https://twitter.com/mudnasty2/status/1527673460037627905)

### 19/ 哪些项目会持续下去？

押注那些解决实际问题且竞争对手无法解决的产品和项目。 
  
 熊市感觉很可怕，但它们对生态系统来说是健康的。 
  
 他们摆脱了所有的自重（去泡沫）。

[https://twitter.com/erkona/status/1527362849105842176](https://twitter.com/erkona/status/1527362849105842176)

### 20/ 战胜 ETH 和 BTC

作为投资者，你的目标（投资组合）应该是超越 $ETH 和 $BTC 
  
 所以你要衡量你的加密投资组合，如果收益率无法高于它们，那么就购买 $ETH 和 $BTC 会让你更省心。

title: Content Creation & Internet
body:
Back in the early days of the internet, the priority was to provide reliable communication. Without communication there is no real network. Once communication was reliably solved, you got your email, chat etc. After communication was done the next thing that became important was sharing knowledge. Once humans can send each other messages it turns out they want to share richer content and know how about the world. 
 Instead of pushing content via email if you could put it permanently in a virtual space(website) and anyone could come visit it at their own convenience and learn from it, wouldn’t that be great! 
  
 Eventually there was so much content search became an important feature(google!) for the internet. Internet was building its knowledge layer, allowing humans to share anything and everything. There were blogs, forums, hand made websites and what not. Eventually social media abstracted the blogs further to provide a single blog, theme, dns all preconfigured for everyone. To just do one thing - create content. 
 At the end of the day internet geared up to maximise content creation, building all sorts of tools to make it easy to create and share content. 
  
 Content creation will remain a foundational layer on the internet, the part above communication where knowledge and entertainment is shared. 
  
 **Knowledge Networks!**

* 为金融危机做准备
* 照顾好家人
* 使用任何业余时间学习技能

[https://twitter.com/TheGuySwann/status/1527339390514581513](https://twitter.com/TheGuySwann/status/1527339390514581513)

### 4/ 大多数币价将永远不会破前高

项目资金耗尽，开发人员失去信心后退场。或者新的项目出现并取代你的热度，要知道大多币价从未恢复其前高。 
  
 不要以为一切都会回来，有些事情会永久沉寂，应该专注于建立人们真正想要的和真正有价值的事情上。

[https://twitter.com/nic__carter/status/1527360963183525891](https://twitter.com/nic__carter/status/1527360963183525891)

### 5/ 也许你不应该卖掉你的币

这也取决于你投资的项目，我一直持有 $BNB $VET 经历了2018年的寒冬，最终起飞 
  
 警告：沉默成本偏见、幸存者偏见、小道消息、幻想起飞 
  
 坚持持有有价值的组合，然后忘记它们笃定未来，重新开始，在熊市慢慢研究和积累

[https://twitter.com/0xOGDegen/status/1527276167115546625](https://twitter.com/0xOGDegen/status/1527276167115546625)

### 6/ 不要信仰（不断调整你的判断）

每一个周期都有它的宠儿 
 • 2017: EOS, NEO, XRP 
 • 2020: DeFi 1.0 Protocols 
  
 他们在主要周期中表现良好，但无法保持后来的周期中的动力。 
  
 元宇宙的玩法会发生变化，或者他们会创新。

[https://twitter.com/TraderDefi/status/1527406610858921984](https://twitter.com/TraderDefi/status/1527406610858921984)

### 7/ 关注项目方

谁仍在迭代他们的产品？ 
 谁仍在与社区互动？ 
  
 韭菜们应该把精力花在那些在熊市仍然在努力工作的项目上

[https://twitter.com/MrBenLilly/status/1527446869206618112](https://twitter.com/MrBenLilly/status/1527446869206618112)

### 8/ 投资你的健康和友谊

你可能在熊市损失了很多，但还有什么事情比健康和友谊更重要？ 
  
 要重视非加密社区的友谊，这会让你保持理智，保持身心健康，这将是你绝望时需要的

[https://twitter.com/MarkBeylin/status/1527361777675055114](https://twitter.com/MarkBeylin/status/1527361777675055114)

### 9/ 不要追求过高的收益率

我们倾向于高估来自通胀代币的收益率，如果它的价值跌了95%，那么即使200%的年化收益又有什么用。

[https://twitter.com/ProtocolUpdate/status/1527365094790705158](https://twitter.com/ProtocolUpdate/status/1527365094790705158)

### 10/ 改善你的投资公式

不管你是否意识到，你脑子里都有一个投资算法。 
  
 坐下来反思。写下你的规则和原则。 
  
 做真实的自己，否则你会在下一个周期犯同样的错误。 
  
 活下来更重要

[https://twitter.com/Tradermayne/status/1527436636190937088](https://twitter.com/Tradermayne/status/1527436636190937088)

### 11/ 生存优先

尽一切可能活下来 
  
 降低支出（个人和企业） 
  
 改造/重组

[https://twitter.com/danheld/status/1527337849561174021](https://twitter.com/danheld/status/1527337849561174021)

### 12/ 不急于抄底

底部需要一段时间才能形成，有人建议等待一年后再买入加密资产。 
  
 也有人建议不要尝试抄底，而是通过定投摊平成本

[https://twitter.com/cryptorabbitt/status/1527273501534654464](https://twitter.com/cryptorabbitt/status/1527273501534654464)

### 13/ 等待新的加密世界（或元宇宙）

在下一个周期到来时可能现在最有价值的协议都不复存在了 
 要时刻保持对市场的热情和兴趣，这样将不会错过 
 早期参与者时获利最多的，机遇是在熊市中产生的

[https://twitter.com/TraderDefi/status/1527368210642702336](https://twitter.com/TraderDefi/status/1527368210642702336)

### 14/ 不要与美联储抗争（看懂经济周期）

目前，加密货币与美联储的货币政策强相关。

* 牛市时美联储疯狂印钱释放流动性
* 熊市时美联储加息锁表收缩流动性

请注意美联储如何打击通货膨胀和控制货币供应。

不要与之抗争。

[https://twitter.com/producer_fred/status/1527279159977734144](https://twitter.com/producer_fred/status/1527279159977734144)

### 15/ 寻找爱好

要耐心等待。 
  
 同时，出去享受生活。 
  
 出去旅行（身心愉悦）是在熊市期间获得的最好的投资回报率

[https://twitter.com/rogenecoin/status/1527306776537747456](https://twitter.com/rogenecoin/status/1527306776537747456)

### 16/ 建立额外的收入来源

1. 保持低仓位，不要太激进 
2. 有一个不相关的收入来源
3. 蓝筹项目在价格疲软时要坚定信念
4. 持续学习

[https://twitter.com/probablymato/status/1527301734250340357](https://twitter.com/probablymato/status/1527301734250340357)

### 17/ 不要尝试击败市场

一定有人通过炒合约和炒短线来频繁交易，不要这么做，这很容易亏钱 
  
 大多数人应该持续定投蓝筹项目

[https://twitter.com/jasonczmeng/status/1527285855643045889](https://twitter.com/jasonczmeng/status/1527285855643045889)

### 18/ 价值投资

很难预测你抄底的认为很棒的项目能否价格恢复前高，大多数人应该坚持购买 $BTC $ETH 这些龙头项目。 
  
 市场既需要冲动也需要重拾信心，但是这很正常不要紧张 
  
 要进行学习和研究来提高认知

[https://twitter.com/mudnasty2/status/1527673460037627905](https://twitter.com/mudnasty2/status/1527673460037627905)

### 19/ 哪些项目会持续下去？

押注那些解决实际问题且竞争对手无法解决的产品和项目。 
  
 熊市感觉很可怕，但它们对生态系统来说是健康的。 
  
 他们摆脱了所有的自重（去泡沫）。

[https://twitter.com/erkona/status/1527362849105842176](https://twitter.com/erkona/status/1527362849105842176)

### 20/ 战胜 ETH 和 BTC

作为投资者，你的目标（投资组合）应该是超越 $ETH 和 $BTC 
  
 所以你要衡量你的加密投资组合，如果收益率无法高于它们，那么就购买 $ETH 和 $BTC 会让你更省心。

[https://twitter.com/derpaderpederp/status/1527573163076468736](https://twitter.com/derpaderpederp/status/1527573163076468736)

title: What is The Tulua Project?
body:
Hello Friends,

We really appreciate everyone that has supported us to this point, we could not have done it without you. We are now entering a new era of The Tulua Project, which will be further explained in this article. To clarify, we are a creative blockchain company that strives to create a platform and franchise that revolves around exploring sound in all its expressions.  In order to do this, we have been slowly creating a world where Creatures of Sound can live in harmony with one another and communicate solely through vibrations and frequencies on their home, Tulua Island. The heart, represented by the Tulua shell, will be the only way Creatures of Sound can be born and enter Tulua Island. Each creature will have a unique shell for their avatar, which will represent how fragile and soft they are on the inside, yet hard and bold on the outside.

![Tulua Shell](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-K1KjBl2KN3kJo_ABrKkx.png?height=1412&width=1738)

In order to kick this project off, we will be creating different NFT Collections and short animated films to represent different elements of the world. The NFT collections will represent different aspects of the world while the short films will allow us to tell stories and create narratives about the world.  Pangea will be the first project we take on, which will explain the origin story of Tulua Island through the use of microscopic worlds and music. We eventually intend for this project to become a virtual world, however, our main goal now is to focus on building the franchise and telling the story we have in mind. The end goal is to build a place where sound can be both explored and created with like-minded individuals.

___________________________________________________________________________________________

### What We Have Done So Far:

### The Dancers - 

The first collection we deployed was The Dancers, which is the integration of infrared hardware technology, dance, software, and music. This was our first attempt to get our feet wet into the web3 world coming from web2 and traditional industry methods. The main focus was to build a direct relationship with fans that believed in our music, and our creative pursuits as artists. We decided to do deployments of 10 Dancers for each drop in order to make sure the connection with our growing community maintained intimate and organic in this initial phase.

We then implemented the **utility** of providing our Dancer holders with a **curated recorded radio mix** by The Tulua Project, **5 song recommendations of 5 genres** (World, Electronic, Neo-Classical, Jazz, and a weekly exclusive pick), **a physical send out of goods** including a curated book, wellness items, and a **Tulua T-shirt**, and an **airdrop of a Tulua Shell** which will grant them access to being a Creature of Sound on Tulua Island.

So far we have released two drops (so 20 total Dancers) and 18 have been collected. This has been an exciting part of the project as we are able to go for quality within our community as opposed to quantity. **Ensuring that we provide our super fans with the most return in terms of care and love.** 

**Dancers (OpenSea):**

[https://opensea.io/collection/the-tulua-project](https://opensea.io/collection/the-tulua-project)

### The Tulua Project Music Catalog - 

As music producers and composers, we wanted to be able to **consistently release music while retaining that highly-valued relationship between our fans and our songs.** So we started our own Music Catalog within The Tulua Project ecosystem, where we release a single every week with 5 Collector Edition NFTs.

These Collector Edition NFTs are initially the cover art of the respective single that fans are able to collect, **which we then airdrop collectors a unique audio visualizer of the song that we create.** We hope to build the infrastructure to where collectors can just refresh the metadata of the song collected and have the audio visualizer instantly. 

The reason we don’t have the audio visualizer as the collector edition instantly is that we are a small team and they take a bit longer to create. **We want to make sure we provide our fans with the highest quality we can provide, while still sustaining a consistent weekly release schedule of our music.**

Later on, we hope to connect our Music Catalog to the Tulua universe that we are creating, potentially having these songs as **part of a sacred sound manifesto** that is pinnacle to the origins of the Tulua world

**Music Catalog (OpenSea):**

[https://opensea.io/collection/the-tulua-project-music-catalog](https://opensea.io/collection/the-tulua-project-music-catalog)

Visualizer (OpenSea):

[https://opensea.io/collection/tuluaaudiovisualizer](https://opensea.io/collection/tuluaaudiovisualizer)

### Live Events - 

Since we are now based in Los Angeles, we have been able to have opportunities to be involved in the music scene here. We have been able to partner with various collaborators in the scene such as Product Pluto, Dunia Musik, Lanea Santa Monica, and Pattern Bar to name a few. The Tulua Project performing duo has played shows in venues in places such as Downtown Los Angeles, Downtown Santa Monica, Joshua Tree, Hollywood, Downtown Santa Barbara and more. 

___________________________________________________________________________________________

There are three ways to gain access to this world and claim your own Creature of Sound:

**1 - Symphony DAO**

We understand that not everyone is financially able to mint an NFT, so we wanted to create a way through which someone can earn a shell, hence become a Creature of Sound in our world. Symphony DAO is The Tulua Projects’ mission to create a community of music producers and composers, where completing full compositions should be rewarded.

Earn $TULUA as a Music Composer and Producer

HOW IT WORKS:

1. Every week we post 2 prompts for music composers and producers to have as the framework for their compositions.
2. The deadline for submissions is by **9 PM PST on the respective Sunday that week**
3. The following week **$TULUA tokens** will be granted to those that have submitted their songs. **1 Prompted Composition Submission = 1 $TULUA Token** (Max $TULUA tokens one can receive per week are 2).
4. $TULUA Token earners will then receive rewards and credentials within The Tulua Project (What is The Tulua Project? More on that here)
5. The first season of $TULUA Tokens will run for a schedule of 8 weeks (May 30 - July 31) which means the maximum amount of $TULUA tokens you can earn in this first season is 16

To learn more about Symphony DAO please [click here](https://mirror.xyz/0x6C46354fD01B923F736178710abE32EA81b51Bb7/Ys4ZcJAtL2LS4uLb0ULcz418Vi8zDGNyKpSISpaY5JU).

**2 - Owning a Dancer**

The Dancer collection was The Tulua Project’s first step into the web3 space. In the world we are creating, The Dancers will serve as a process from the Sonic Angels through which a Tulua Shell heart is born. The Dancers will not actually exist in the world, but as soon as a Dancer is minted, the color pigments will be extracted from it by the Sonic Angels in order to create a shell for the holders’ avatar. Thus birthing them as a Creature of Sound which will grant the holder access to Tulua Island.

![The Dancers](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XHyH5RN7RelOb-TOcDup8.jpeg?height=2000&width=2000)

**3 - Attending Events**

By attending Tulua events, one is able to work their way to earning a Creature of Sound. One is able to earn two tokens just by attending one event and needs a total of 6 tokens in order to qualify for a creature of sound.

![How to claim a Creature of Sound](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/BQtOI8m3ppt_cppEZT7iZ.png?height=1000&width=1000)

___________________________________________________________________________________________

title: Crypto dictionary
body:
Bitico appeared in 2009, but it was the beginning of the end. To help you understand a bit more about these terms and interact with the cryptoassets universe, we have prepared a complete dictionary of all the most commonly used slang in this medium.

***A***

**Addy**

Address of a cryptocurrency wallet.

**Altcoin**

Term for alternative currencies to Bitcoin. Example: Eth, Litecoin, Dogecoin, Dash, Aioz, etc.

**ABC**

Acronym for anti-money laundering, in Portuguese: anti-money laundering. These are techniques to prevent money laundering, such as receiving money only through a bank transfer and the account holder itself, as Brazilian exchanges already do.

**Ask price**

This is the minimum price at which someone is willing to sell their asset.

**ASIC**

Application-specific integrated circuit acronym, in Portuguese: application-specific integrated circuits. Chip designed specifically for a particular task, e.g. in the case of Bitcoin, ASICs were designed to process a SHA -256 hash and mine Bitcoins.

**ATH**

The highest price ever reached by a particular cryptocurrency.

**Active**

Refers to a person's assets. For example, if there is $5,000.00 in a bank account, these are the assets in that bank account. In the case of cryptocurrencies, "Digital Assets" or "Crypto Assets".

**ATM**

ATM or in Portuguese: electronic box. where users can buy and sell Bitcoin using physical cash or debit cards. They are available in Brazil around the world, including some cities 

![Metamask wallet, arrow to reference the address.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/KAZsRH_1E0HrxwBTBwrEI.png?height=726&width=1280)

***B***

**Ballast**

It is an asset that aims to provide a guarantee, i.e. it combines an initially worthless asset with something that has an implicit value. Today there are assets backed by BTC, DOLLAR, REAL, etc.

**Bear**

From the English, "Bear." The "Bear" is an investor who believes that the price of a cryptocurrency can fall at any moment. Thus, the Bear sells his assets before they depreciate too much. When we say that a market is "Bearish", it means that there are more sell orders than buy orders at that moment.

**Bearish**

This is an aggressive top-down chart behavior (characterized by a sharp decline and a short rally).

**bitcoin**

Starts with a lowercase letter and represents the monetary unit of the Bitcoin protocol.

**Bitcoin**

Starts with a capital letter and represents the protocol developed by Satoshi Nakamoto.

**Block Explorer**

Also known as a blockchain browser, this is a website or computer program that allows you to view transactions, addresses, blocks, and all the information of a blockchain and a particular cryptocurrency.

**Blockchain**

Blockchain, also known as trust protocol, is a distributed ledger technology that aims at decentralization as a security measure. It is considered Bitcoin's most important technological innovation as it is the proof of all transactions on the network. It records and stores all transactions in Bitcoin's history.

**Blockchain.info**

Company that offers a wallet service and a block explorer, confused with the Bitcoin blockchain.

**BTC**

Abbreviation for the currency unit of Bitcoin.

**Bull**

Means "Taurus" in English and is exactly the opposite of "Bear". The bull is the investor who believes in the cryptocurrency price trend. He bets on buying the currency at a low price to make a profit when the value rises.

**bullish**

It is an aggressive bottom-up chart behavior (characterized by a sharp rise and a short fall). It is also used to signal optimism for the market.

![Bulls vs Bears.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/K3PMkhgFCF2nLfjJjWA-9.png?height=1080&width=1080)

***C***

**Candlestick**

Candlestick is a graphical representation of the price of an asset. It allows to see the opening, high, low and closing prices within a time frame in the chart.

**Confirmation time**

Confirmation time is the time that elapses between a transaction being sent to the network and it being recorded in a block. Basically, it is the time a user has to wait before his transaction is confirmed on the network.

**Cold Storage**

A way to store cryptocurrencies offline, using paper, metal, or another alternative that allows cryptocurrencies to be stored or moved.

**Crypto**

Cryptography is a set of encryptions used to protect information in a way that only the sender and receiver can understand. It is used throughout the blockchain ecosystem and today by some companies like Facebook.

**Cryptocurrency**

Cryptocurrencies are digital currencies such as Bitcoin, Litecoin, Ethereum and many others that use cryptography for various purposes. Among other things, to ensure that all transactions are 100% secure.

**Custody**

To have control and ownership of assets. Having a wallet or assets in custody can also mean that your keys remain private and confidential.

**cypherpunk**

Cypherpunk is a community of online privacy and anonymity advocates. Their motto is: cypherpunks write code. They believe that those who want to protect their privacy should do it themselves instead of waiting for others to do it for them.

***D***

**Daytrader**

Investor who makes daily moves by buying and selling assets.

**Dump**

Sudden drop in the prices of cryptocurrencies.

**Dust transaction**

Transaction involving a small amount of bitcoins with little financial value, but which takes up space on the blockchain.

***E***

**ETH**

Ticker symbol of the cryptocurrency Ethereum.

**Escrow account**

Term used to describe the holding of funds in the possession of a third party to protect oneself during an operation.

**Ether**
Ethereum currency unit used to pay your blockchain fees.

**Ethereum**
Ethereum is a blockchain that permits the programming of decentralized applications, smart contracts and transactions of the cryptocurrency Ether and different tokens, as well as the creation of NFT collections and decentralized programs.

**Exchange**

Local, centralized, or decentralized exchange between cryptocurrencies and other assets, for example, exchanging dollars for bitcoin. Bitcoin exchanges are used to exchange bitcoin for FIAT coins or other cryptocurrencies.

***F***

**Faucet**

Websites that offer rewards in cryptocurrency for clicking ads or performing small tasks. Here is how: Answer a survey, provide your data, etc.

**Fee**

Fees paid on a transaction, for example: conversions, transfers and withdrawals.

**Fiat**

Conventional money (fiduciary money), i.e. money that is not a cryptocurrency, such as euros, reals, dollars, etc.

**FOMO**

Fear of missing out or fear of missing out on a profitable opportunity.

**Fork**

Updates to the cryptocurrency codes of coins, called a fork. A new coin that emerges from another, such as Bitcoin Dash, which is a fork of Bitcoin.

**Full Node**

It is the program that contains the consensus rules of the Bitcoin network and a full copy of the blockchain. Not every full node is a miner, but every miner is a full node.

***G***

**Gas**

The term gas refers to a pricing mechanism on the Ethereum network. It calculates the fees for executing a transaction or a smart contract operation.

**Genesis Block**

The first block of Bitcoin, created by Satoshi Nakamoto.

**GPU**

Graphical Processing Unit. Chip for processing complex mathematical calculations required for running games and software that require a lot of graphics resources.

***H***

**Halving**

Bitcoin halving is the emissions reduction that occurs every 4 years, as defined in the code.

**Hash**

An algorithm used by the Bitcoin protocol and other cryptocurrencies to convert a large amount of information into a fixed-length hexadecimal string of numbers.

**Hash Rate**

Number of hashes processed by a miner in a given period of time.

**HOLD**

In Portuguese, it means "to hold", i.e. we hold the asset even in the event of a significant devaluation, thinking about future valuations.

**Hot wallet**

It is a cryptocurrency wallet that is online and connected to the Internet. Like Metamask, Binance wallet, Trust wallet, Phantom and many others.

**Hype**

A term that indicates that something is the trend of the moment. For example, "NFTs are in an absurd hype".

***I***

**ICO**

Initial Coin Offering is a system for raising funds for a startup or company. Usually they come up with "revolutionary or unique ideas" that are applied on a blockchain.

**IDO**

Initial Dex Offering, A IDO is a crypto token offering conducted on a decentralized exchange (DEX).

**INPUT**

Origin address of a bitcoin transaction. A single transaction can have multiple origin addresses.

***K***

***Kilohashes/second - kH/s***

Number of possible attempts to resolve a hash in a given second, measured in thousands of hashes.

***KYC***

Know your customer, in Portuguese. These are guidelines that government institutions impose on companies to find out who they are doing business with, i.e. they have data and documents of their customers.

***L***

**Ledger**

The ledger is a shared record of information, like a bank cash book, a book where all financial transactions in a bank are recorded, the ledger would be a place where transactions of cryptocurrencies running on the blockchain are recorded. . Today, it is also a wallet that allows cryptocurrencies to be stored without an internet connection.

**Liquidity**

It is the ability to buy or sell an asset easily, even in large quantities.

![Ledger used to store private keys securely.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/eqe_0q0uws5zc_0jzyNZl.png?height=438&width=500)

***M***

**Malleability**

Ability to change uncommitted transactions without invalidating them.

**Manufacturer**

Maker is a term used when you place an order and it is not immediately traded. The order stays on the order book waiting for someone else to send a counter order so it can be executed.

**Marketcap**

The famous market cap. Amount of cryptocurrency circulating X crypto price.

**Megahashes/sec - MH /s**

Number of possible attempts to resolve a hash in a given second, measured in millions of hashes.

**MicroBit - uBTC**

One millionth part of 1 Bitcoin or 0.000001 BTC.

**MilliBit - mBTC**

One thousandth part of 1 Bitcoin or 0.001 BTC.

**Mining**

This is the process of performing mathematical calculations. When a computer performs these cryptographic calculations, it receives a reward, X Bitcoin. We say that it mines and creates more Bitcoin.

**Mixer**

Service that encrypts the input and output of transactions to maintain privacy and reduce traceability.

***N***

**Node**

Device connected to the Bitcoin network that uses a computer program to forward transactions to other nodes, creating a decentralized network.

***O***

**Order:**

Market order that executes the purchase regardless of the price.

STOP -LIMIT orde - You choose a price and tell the system: "When the currency reaches X dollars, place an order LIMIT for Y dollars".

**Output**

Destination address for a bitcoin transaction. It is possible for a transaction to have multiple outputs.

***P***

**P2P**

P2P (Peer-to-Peer). Bitcoin was designed as a peer-to-peer system, meaning it does not need intermediaries, such as central banks, to broker a transaction between two people. In the market, this term is used to describe the trading of cryptocurrencies between two parties without the need for an exchange.

**Paper wallet**

It is considered a very safe way to store your cryptocurrencies, as they are not exposed to much risk precisely because they are offline. Since you do not need access to the Internet, it's basically a piece of paper that contains your private and public keys.

**Phishing**

In phishing, the user clicks on or downloads a fake file to steal information. Due to the popularity of cryptocurrencies, fake emails, files that change the victim's router settings or Google ads are spread more and more often to make the site appear first.

**Pool**

A collection of miners who join together to mine a block, and then divide the rewards among themselves. Mining pools are a great way to increase the probability of success as the difficulty increases.

**PoW**

It is the proof that a transaction has been validated and is legitimate. Using a mathematical function (SHA -256), transactions are encrypted and sent to the network where miners compete to decrypt them.

**Profit**

When we buy/ sell crypto and make profits.

**Pump**

When the price of a currency goes up.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3yfkb1zB1zKx5CtrUtCRZ.png?height=576&width=1024)

***R***

**Rekt**

The correct term would be "Wrecked", which means "ruined". It is the investor who has lost everything and ruined his equity when the price falls.

**ROI**

The return on an investment.

***s***

**Satoshi**

Smallest part of a Bitcoin = 0.00000001 BTC. If someone says they have 10 Satoshis, it means they have 0.00000010 BTC.

**Satoshi Nakamoto**

The name of the alleged inventor of Bitcoin.

**Scam**

Scams and frauds that are very common in cryptocurrency projects.

**ScamCoin**

Altcoin created with the purpose of defrauding users and enriching creators.

**SEPA**

Single European Payments Area, Portuguese, Single European Payments Area, is an integrated payment system between the countries of the Eurozone that allows the transfer of funds between banks and different countries. The transfer process is similar to the TED /DOC that we have in Brazil, but in the case of SEPA it includes all countries that use the euro.

**SHA-256**

Hash-like mathematical function used in Bitcoin in various contexts, including during the mining process.

**ShitCoin**

This term is used to classify fraud coins with little or no standing in the community.

**Smart Contract**

A smart contract - also known as a smart contract or digital contract - is a self-executing computer code designed to facilitate, execute, and protect financial transactions on the blockchain.

**Spread**

Difference between the buy price and the sell price in the order book (book).

**Soft fork**

Update of a coin that does not require the coin system to be restarted with a new blockchain. This usually happens without us noticing.

**swingtrader**

Trading strategy with few operations over time. Take advantage of the market fluctuations.

***T***

**taker**

Taker is the investor who has an order that will be executed immediately if he finds another opposing order.

**Target Tag**

Target tag is a code assigned to each xrp account. It is used to identify the recipient of the transaction, as if it were your house number when an order is delivered.

**Terahashes/sec - TH /s**

Number of possible attempts to resolve a hash in a given second, measured in trillions of hashes (TH /s).

**testnet**

An alternative network used for test development.

**Ticker**
This is the name given to currency symbols: BTC (Bitcoin), ETH (Ethereum), LTC (Litecoin), XRP (Ripple), ADA (Cardano).

**Token**

Cryptocurrencies are coins created to be coins, while tokens are created to be distributed to people with the promise of being worth something in the future. Comparing the two to the conventional investment market, cryptocurrencies could be currencies like USD or EURO, while tokens would be the shares of a company.

**TOR**

Acronym for The Onion Router, in Portuguese. It is a routing protocol used by people who want to maintain their privacy on the net.

**TXID**

Better known as the transaction hash. This is an identifier used to reference transactions in a blockchain.

***V***

**Volatility**

Price movements of an asset.

**W**

Wallet

Wallet is where we can store digital currencies.

**Whale**

As the holder of a large portion of a given currency, the whale is a user that centralizes the currency by controlling its price.

**Withdraw**

Withdraw

***X***

**XBT**

Representation of the currency unit of bitcoin.

**XRP**

Ripple cryptocurrency ticker.

title: ETHEREUM: FINANCING THE FUTURE OF THE INTERNET
body:
In April, the European Investment bank, the lending arm of the European Union, [issued a £100M bond](https://www.coindesk.com/european-investment-bank-issues-121m-digital-notes-using-ethereum) on Ethereum’s blockchain. Just recently, Goldman Sachs announced plans to offer ether futures and options to its clients while the Bank of Israel is testing using Ethereum's technology in an internally launched digital shekel trial. Ethereum has been in the news a lot lately due to the NFTs craze earlier this year. If you can remember, Beeple sold his Everyday's NFT Collection for $69M worth of Ether. That’s a crazy amount of money, right?

The Ethereum white paper was published in 2013. In this paper, the author, Vitalik Buterin argued that blockchain can enable much more than just be a database for money. He envisioned Ethereum, the blockchain could be programmable thus enabling derivatives, lending and borrowing among other applications. The Ethereum project was later kick-started in 2015.

                                                        **Economics of Ethereum**

Before we go into the details of how the Ethereum network works, let’s first make sure that you have an idea of how its underlying technology works. The Bitcoin blockchain’s native currency is bitcoin as Ethereum’s is Ether. The network makes money by charging transaction fees on activities in the network.

The initial concept of bitcoin was digital currency while that of Ethereum was programmable money. Programmable money means that applications and smart contracts can be built on top of the Ethereum blockchain. While Bitcoin is restricted to being a store of value, medium of exchange and a unit of account, Ether facilitates all that and powers decentralized exchanges, derivatives and other hosts of financial applications. The composability of Ether gives it an edge over bitcoin as it able to finance much of the activities in the crypto world.

Given the recent rise in usage of decentralized applications(dApps) in the Ethereum ecosystem, the [transaction fees (gas fees) have been ridiculously high ](https://www.coindesk.com/ethereum-gas-limit-eth-price-soars)as miners prioritize transactions with high gas fees. These high transaction fees have harbored a continued adoption of the ecosystem. The Ethereum network is secured by the **proof of work** consensus mechanism which we will explain later which is similar to that of the Bitcoin network. According to [KPMG](https://assets.kpmg/content/dam/kpmg/pdf/2016/06/kpmg-blockchain-consensus-mechanism.pdf?aid=fndrabg_p?aid=fndrabg_p), a consensus mechanism is a method of authenticating and validating a value or transaction on a Blockchain or a distributed ledger without the need to trust or rely on a central authority.

In the proof of work consensus mechanism, workers agree on the state of the blockchain (account balances and the order of transactions) by expending computational effort(mining) and validating that said effort has indeed been used. Proof of work ensures that the network remains secure and that double spending doesn’t occur. The workers are incentivized to mine the main Ethereum blockchain by issuing new currency into the ecosystem and earning transaction fees as a reward. Ethereum's yearly network issuance at the moment is at 4% per year with 2 Ether per block and 1.75 Ether per uncle block which is rewarded to miners. This issuance policy is enforced in the network by developers, miners, community members and ecosystem projects.

The current proof of work consensus mechanism has faced a few challenges that have slowed down the Ethereum ecosystem’s adoption rate. Some of the caveats include:

1. Currently, the Ethereum blockchain can process 19 transactions per second while Visa processes 1700 per second.
2. The rise in gas fees has made it expensive to conduct transactions on the network.
3. Environmental concerns arise since the proof of work mechanism consumes a lot of electricity.
4. The ecosystem faces volatility concerns since gas fees tend to drastically change due to supply-demand forces. For example, while registering my [ens domain ](https://ens.domain/)I found it cheaper to do so early in the morning as gas prices were lower.
5. Ethereum doesn’t have a supply cap, unlike Bitcoin’s network which is at 21M bitcoins. This means that Ethereum is inflationary thus diluting the efforts of the miners.

Two proposals have been made to solve the problems of the current system. These proposals can be classified as layer-1 or layer-2 solutions. Layer-1 solutions are those that make improvements on the base protocol with the intention of enhancing the scalability of the system. The Bitcoin and Ethereum blockchains are considered layer-1 as they settle all transactions in their own network. Layer-2 refers to the overlaying infrastructure built on top of the layer-1 chain.

The two proposals are:

1. **EIP-1559:**

The Ethereum Improvement Proposal(EIP) 1559 aims to change how gas fees are processed by splitting them into base fees and tips. With EIP-1559, popularly known as Ethereum's Scarcity Engine or Ethereum's Burn Mechanism, Ethereum’s annual supply may reduce to less than 1% per annum since the network is migrating from proof of work to proof of stake, a concept that we will explore later.

![Source: Dune Analytics](https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/SC-HmDjGm-JwuMkjmYB7dPMzWARo6inbbMjGnRqHDlPDWYkc1UgS6x22fXIHPcTJ-KcLeafAgSiFljmjEG0NEeWlhtP14NpeIhkFjnAWrQaG6lUdCEKZyuQR9EEGVeE7TTrkmvFl)

Let’s look into why EIP-1559 is nicknamed Ethereum’s burn mechanism. Currently, gas fees are awarded to the workers to incentivize them to secure the network and validate transactions. In the new proposal, the base fees are burned and the tips are awarded to network validators. The burnt base fees ensure that the miners aren't incentivized to artificially congest the network, by prioritizing transactions with higher gas fees hence raising the transaction fees to be paid. EIP-1559 leads Ethereum to become a deflationary asset thus making it **ultrasound money**. You can watch a simulation on how much ETH gets burnt with this new proposal on **[watch the burn](http://watchtheburn.com/)**\*\*. \*\*EIP-1559 is set to go live on August 4th, 2021.

![ Dune Analytics](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/E4MuDajVIAErcJP?format=jpg&name=large)

**2. Ethereum 2.0**:

         i) **Change in the consensus mechanism**

Ethereum's consensus mechanism is being migrated from proof of work to proof of stake. Instead of using mining to validate the state of the blockchain to generate rewards, individuals will have to stake 32 Ether to become validators in the network. This proof of stake chain, also known as the beacon chain, was implemented in December 2020 and will be merged with the rest of the chain sometime in 2022. According to glassnode, over $5.5M in ETH has been held up in the ETH 2.0 contract. With this migration taking effect, it is projected that ETH's supply will reduce by about 90%, a phenomenon called the Cliffening by the Ethereum community. However, this proof of stake move is not new in the blockchain world as networks such as Cardano have been using it. Proof of stake was first implemented in 2012 when Peer Coin was introduced. 

The proof of stake consensus mechanism has a couple of improvements from the proof of work.  Proof of stake will reduce Ethereum’s overall carbon footprint as electricity consumed will drastically reduce. Consequently, the cost of being a ‘miner’ will reduce since one will only need to stake Ether and not only purchase expensive hardware but also pay for the high electricity bills. Migrating will also reduce the miner's selling pressure as before they had to sell their rewards to foot their electricity bills amongst other maintenance costs. Therefore, it lowers the entry barrier to becoming a validator. To become a validator, all you need is an internet connection, 32 Ether, raspberry pi, and an SSD.

![proof of work vs proof of stake](https://d3lkc3n5th01x7.cloudfront.net/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/16000143/Proof_of_Work_vs_Proof_of_Stake5.jpg)

Proof of stake offers better security as compared to proof of work. More nodes will be available in Proof of stake thus strengthening the overall security of the network. The network is less susceptible to a 51% attack unlike when it was in the previous consensus mechanism. A 51% attack is whereby a miner or mining pool is able to control 51% or more of the network's computation power or hash rate thus invalidating the other miner's work, transactions and can even double-spend the rewards.  \\

In proof of stake, if a validator attacks the network, it will quell the attack by seizing the validator’s staked Ether. This type of defense mechanism by the Ethereum network is called **stake slashing**. By seizing the staked Ether, the consensus mechanism is able to prevent the 51% attack from being carried out. The second type of network defense is called **layer one ‘slashing’** and is triggered when you go against the protocol’s consensus. The corollary to this is, is that the network will slash your staked Ether by a third. For each attack, the validator will have to acquire new Ether from the market, and thanks to the law of demand and supply, purchasing Ether in every new iteration will be costlier than the previous iteration. The slashed Ether will be distributed to more honest nodes. As Vitalik states, this defense mechanism limits the attacker’s economic resources.

  **ii)** **Addressing Scaling**

Ethereum 2.0 introduces sharding which will be useful in the on-chain scaling of the network. Sharding, a layer 1 solution, involves splitting the database to reduce the load on the network. This means that a validator will not have to process all the transactions on the Ethereum mainnet. The result of sharding is increased transaction speeds and reduced transaction costs as network congestions will be reduced too. All this will be carried out without compromising the security of the network.

The beacon chain, which is labeled a coordination layer does so by assigning nodes to shard chains. Communication on-chain is also coordinated by receiving and storing transaction data which will be accessible by other shards.

![ Why sharding is great: demystifying the technical properties](https://vitalik.ca/images/sharding-files/beacon_chain.jpg)

Another scaling technique is called off-chain scaling. By off-chain scaling, executed transactions are handled off the mainnet and on layer 2. The technique is called **rollups** where transactions are not executed on the mainnet but the transactions data are posted on the mainnet to reach consensus.  There are currently two kinds of rollups, zero-knowledge[ rollups and optimistic rollups](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/scaling/layer-2-rollups/#rollups). Rollups are useful for ensuring that the network is open for participation, reduced transaction costs and faster transaction speeds.

                                             **Triple point money**

In David Hoffman’s[ Ether: A New Model for Money piece](https://medium.com/pov-crypto/ether-a-new-model-for-money-17365b5535ba), he introduced the concept of Ether being triple-point money in the following ways:

1\. **Store of value:** Assets that are scarce and value continues to persist across time and space. Ether that is locked up in DeFi applications.

2\. **Consumable asset:** This is Ether used as gas fees with the implementation of EIP 1559.

3\. **Capital asset:** Ether is that is staked for validation in the new proof-of-stake consensus mechanism is considered a capital asset

![Source: Ether: A New Model for Money](https://miro.medium.com/max/3520/1\*MFEEDnl-35YpJAMR25C04Q.png)

The thermodynamic concept where an element can exist in both gas, liquid and solid-state can also be used to explain Ether as triple point money. In solid-state, Ether is staked by validators. In the liquid state, Ether is available in the markets to be consumed while in the gas state, it is burned as base fees.

                                              **Ultrasound money**

Earlier we mentioned, Ether is becoming ultrasound money due to its deflationary nature in the upcoming upgrade. Let's now explain what Ether being ultrasound money entails. Justin Drake coined the term ultrasound money in regards to the migration to Ethereum 2.0 which as we explained earlier entailed the implementation of EIP 1559, sharding and proof-of-stake consensus engine. Bitcoin has a capped supply of 21M BTC hence considered sound money while Ethereum is considered ultrasound money since it will eventually have a decreasing supply.

![Source: Justin Drake](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ehj389tWoAggIKx?format=jpg&name=large)

Justin modeled the road to 100M Ether to emphasize this point.

![On the Road to 100M ETH](https://digitalpress.fra1.cdn.digitaloceanspaces.com/b9cp0jr/2021/11/Screenshot-2021-11-15-at-09.07.16.png)

If this projected model is correct and Ether is still financing most DeFi activities, the price of Ether will eventually rise as supply cannot meet the demand for the asset.

                    **Why should you care about Ethereum?**

Now that we’ve learned about the past, present and future of Ethereum, let’s look at why you should pay attention to it. Ethereum experiences platform network effects like no other crypto ecosystem, from apps, tokens, liquidity and developer community. The more legitimate and useful products are built on top of it, the higher the price of Ether rises as there’s an organic demand for it.

Ethereum has had a stellar Q1 this year with the [ecosystem reporting a few key results ](https://draecomino.substack.com/p/ethereum-q1-2021-results):

* Total value locked in DeFi increased by 64x to $52B in Q1 2020 as compared with $0.8B in Q1 2020
* NFT art sales increased by 560x to $360M as compared with $0.7M in Q1 2020
* Volume in Decentralized exchanges increased by 76x to $177B in Q1 2021 as compared with $2.3B in Q1 2020.

![Source: James Wang, Ethereum Ethereum Announces First Quarter 2021 Results](https://cdn.substack.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2Fc829e2ad-7a63-4587-aa19-faf5c1928367_982x734.png)

These numbers are thanks to the increased adoption in use cases on the Ethereum ecosystem such as [buying real estate in the metaverse](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-19/virtual-land-prices-are-booming-and-now-there-s-a-fund-for-that), [buying art](https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2021/03/12/nft-beeple-christies-blockchain/) , [lending and borrowing](https://www.coindesk.com/pancakeswap-uniswap-sushiswap-crypto-defi-exchange), [buying domain ](https://ens.domains/)and issuing bonds. As of April 2021, there were [146M unique Ethereum wallet addresses](https://consensys.net/reports/defi-report-q1-2021/#Economy-Title) as compared to 130M addresses at the beginning of the year. Ethereum has settled $2.5 trillion in transactions in Q2 2021. According to data from Dune Analytics, the total number of unique addresses interacting with Ethereum's DeFi ecosystems has reached 3M. There are over 252,428 BTC on Ethereum, which represents slightly over 1% of its total supply. Ethereum is currently settling over $45B in transaction volume per day as compared to Bitcoin's $12B.

Ethereum powers much of the web3 platforms currently in existence. Mirror.xyz, a decentralized writing platform, uses $WRITE tokens to fund the creator’s work. The token is based on Ethereum’s ERC-20 protocol. Mirror allows writers to explore modern funding mechanisms such as crowdfunding, NFTs and even Decentralised Autonomous Organizations(DAOs). The readers are incentivized to support the writer’s work by purchasing a portion of it to receive rewards for ownership of the published work.

![Source: Gitcoin results](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/E3zgCBfUUAQT8a8?format=jpg&name=900x900)

In Q1 2021, Gitcoin funding has allocated over $6M to Ethereum developers in grants, tips and other forms. Since January 2020, $20M has been donated in funding through the same platform to the developers. Since the field is still nascent, there has been a steady increase in demand for web3 developers. In 2020, blockchain was on the top 10 hard skills in demand according to LinkedIn. With the growth of Defi and NFTs, this demand is only set to continue rising.

**Further reading resources:**

**1.** **[Ether: A New Model for Money](https://medium.com/pov-crypto/ether-a-new-model-for-money-17365b5535ba)**

**2.** **[UltraSound money by Justin Drake](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bWqhn1hXvVc&t=4974s&ab_channel=Bankless)**

**3.** **[Why Proof of Stake by Vitalik Buterin](https://vitalik.ca/general/2020/11/06/pos2020.html)**

**4.** **[Consensus' Q1 2021 DeFi Report](https://consensys.net/reports/defi-report-q1-2021/)**

**5.** **[Ethereum Announces First Quarter 2021 Results](https://draecomino.substack.com/p/ethereum-q1-2021-results)**

title: Ethereumの未来
body:
イーサリアムの未来はどうなるのか？

先週、Vitalik Buterinがイーサリアムの未来を予測する論文を共同発表した。

私は37ページの論文を読み、その共著者にインタビューしたので、あなたはそうする必要はないでしょう。

\[🧵スレッド】をご覧ください。］
VitalikButerin氏（@VitalikButerin）によると、未来はsoulbound tokens（SBTs）を中心に展開されるそうです。

SBTは受け取った後に譲渡することができないNFTです。

SBTを受け取ったら、ソウルウォレットに永久に保有することになる。

論文の共著者である@glenweylにインタビューした。

彼は、2022年末にはSBTが早期に利用できるようになると予測している。

彼はまた、"2024年のアップサイクルでは、それらに焦点が当てられるのではないか "とも言っています。

でも、ちょっと待ってください--絶対に転送できないNFTに何の意味があるのでしょうか？

ここで3つのユースケースを考えてみよう。
ユースケース1：大学は、卒業生にSBTの学位を与えることができる。

もし今、大学がNFTの学位を与えたとしたら、卒業生はそれをオンラインで誰にでも売ることができる。

しかし、卒業生がSBT学位を取得した場合、その学位は譲渡も販売もできない。
使用例2：ある企業は、Conference Xに参加した人を採用しようとしている。

Conference Xでは、参加者にSBTバッジを配布したため、誰もオープンマーケットでバッジを購入することができない。

そこで、企業は、Conference Xの参加者として確認された候補者をフィルタリングすることができる。
使用例3：あるDAOは、環境保護主義者のコミュニティを作りたいと考えている。

DAOは、環境会議の出席者と環境プログラムの卒業生にSBTをエアドロップすることができる。

VitalikButerin氏はこれを「souldrop」と呼んでいる。

Vitalikたちはこの世界を「Decentralized Society」と呼んでいます。

私は、これがweb3や広範なオンライン世界の未来だと信じています。

詐欺師や偽者が溢れる中、本物のオンチェーンクレデンシャルを持つことは重要です。
以下は、その論文の全文です。

分散型社会。Web3の魂を見つける
<https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=4105763> このスレッドを楽しんでいただけたなら、私 @iamjasonlevin をフォローし、最初のツイートをリツイートしていただけると本当にありがたいです。

[https://twitter.com/iamjasonlevin/status/1527316022457356301?s=20&t=dQ0vYIEnMIAL0-cXgBznLg](https://twitter.com/iamjasonlevin/status/1527316022457356301?s=20&t=dQ0vYIEnMIAL0-cXgBznLg)

Thread Readerでアンロールできます。

インターネットネイティブなパターンについて学ぶのが好きなら、私のニュースレターをチェックしてみてください。

分散型友情、デジタル不死、アノンアカウントについて書いたことがあります。

title: Crypto dictionary
body:
***[Read it in portuguese](https://mirror.xyz/0x07121d1002B35011B4118751bf6Dca5AC282915E/Sh04-WuqtmVdnNooEeVLkMRdTNwm4U8FtsQ_qUca-vw)***

Bitico appeared in 2009, but it was the beginning of the end. To help you understand a bit more about these terms and interact with the cryptoassets universe, we have prepared a complete dictionary of all the most commonly used slang in this medium.

***A***

**Addy**

Address of a cryptocurrency wallet.

**Altcoin**

Term for alternative currencies to Bitcoin. Example: Eth, Litecoin, Dogecoin, Dash, Aioz, etc.

**ABC**

Acronym for anti-money laundering, in Portuguese: anti-money laundering. These are techniques to prevent money laundering, such as receiving money only through a bank transfer and the account holder itself, as Brazilian exchanges already do.

**Ask price**

This is the minimum price at which someone is willing to sell their asset.

**ASIC**

Application-specific integrated circuit acronym, in Portuguese: application-specific integrated circuits. Chip designed specifically for a particular task, e.g. in the case of Bitcoin, ASICs were designed to process a SHA -256 hash and mine Bitcoins.

**ATH**

The highest price ever reached by a particular cryptocurrency.

**Active**

Refers to a person's assets. For example, if there is $5,000.00 in a bank account, these are the assets in that bank account. In the case of cryptocurrencies, "Digital Assets" or "Crypto Assets".

**ATM**

ATM or in Portuguese: electronic box. where users can buy and sell Bitcoin using physical cash or debit cards. They are available in Brazil around the world, including some cities 

![Metamask wallet, arrow to reference the address.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/KAZsRH_1E0HrxwBTBwrEI.png?height=726&width=1280)

***B***

**Ballast**

It is an asset that aims to provide a guarantee, i.e. it combines an initially worthless asset with something that has an implicit value. Today there are assets backed by BTC, DOLLAR, REAL, etc.

**Bear**

From the English, "Bear." The "Bear" is an investor who believes that the price of a cryptocurrency can fall at any moment. Thus, the Bear sells his assets before they depreciate too much. When we say that a market is "Bearish", it means that there are more sell orders than buy orders at that moment.

**Bearish**

This is an aggressive top-down chart behavior (characterized by a sharp decline and a short rally).

**bitcoin**

Starts with a lowercase letter and represents the monetary unit of the Bitcoin protocol.

**Bitcoin**

Starts with a capital letter and represents the protocol developed by Satoshi Nakamoto.

**Block Explorer**

Also known as a blockchain browser, this is a website or computer program that allows you to view transactions, addresses, blocks, and all the information of a blockchain and a particular cryptocurrency.

**Blockchain**

Blockchain, also known as trust protocol, is a distributed ledger technology that aims at decentralization as a security measure. It is considered Bitcoin's most important technological innovation as it is the proof of all transactions on the network. It records and stores all transactions in Bitcoin's history.

**Blockchain.info**

Company that offers a wallet service and a block explorer, confused with the Bitcoin blockchain.

**BTC**

Abbreviation for the currency unit of Bitcoin.

**Bull**

Means "Taurus" in English and is exactly the opposite of "Bear". The bull is the investor who believes in the cryptocurrency price trend. He bets on buying the currency at a low price to make a profit when the value rises.

**bullish**

It is an aggressive bottom-up chart behavior (characterized by a sharp rise and a short fall). It is also used to signal optimism for the market.

![Bulls vs Bears.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/K3PMkhgFCF2nLfjJjWA-9.png?height=1080&width=1080)

***C***

**Candlestick**

Candlestick is a graphical representation of the price of an asset. It allows to see the opening, high, low and closing prices within a time frame in the chart.

**Confirmation time**

Confirmation time is the time that elapses between a transaction being sent to the network and it being recorded in a block. Basically, it is the time a user has to wait before his transaction is confirmed on the network.

**Cold Storage**

A way to store cryptocurrencies offline, using paper, metal, or another alternative that allows cryptocurrencies to be stored or moved.

**Crypto**

Cryptography is a set of encryptions used to protect information in a way that only the sender and receiver can understand. It is used throughout the blockchain ecosystem and today by some companies like Facebook.

**Cryptocurrency**

Cryptocurrencies are digital currencies such as Bitcoin, Litecoin, Ethereum and many others that use cryptography for various purposes. Among other things, to ensure that all transactions are 100% secure.

**Custody**

To have control and ownership of assets. Having a wallet or assets in custody can also mean that your keys remain private and confidential.

**cypherpunk**

Cypherpunk is a community of online privacy and anonymity advocates. Their motto is: cypherpunks write code. They believe that those who want to protect their privacy should do it themselves instead of waiting for others to do it for them.

***D***

**Daytrader**

Investor who makes daily moves by buying and selling assets.

**Dump**

Sudden drop in the prices of cryptocurrencies.

**Dust transaction**

Transaction involving a small amount of bitcoins with little financial value, but which takes up space on the blockchain.

***E***

**ETH**

Ticker symbol of the cryptocurrency Ethereum.

**Escrow account**

Term used to describe the holding of funds in the possession of a third party to protect oneself during an operation.

**Ether**
Ethereum currency unit used to pay your blockchain fees.

**Ethereum**
Ethereum is a blockchain that permits the programming of decentralized applications, smart contracts and transactions of the cryptocurrency Ether and different tokens, as well as the creation of NFT collections and decentralized programs.

**Exchange**

Local, centralized, or decentralized exchange between cryptocurrencies and other assets, for example, exchanging dollars for bitcoin. Bitcoin exchanges are used to exchange bitcoin for FIAT coins or other cryptocurrencies.

***F***

**Faucet**

Websites that offer rewards in cryptocurrency for clicking ads or performing small tasks. Here is how: Answer a survey, provide your data, etc.

**Fee**

Fees paid on a transaction, for example: conversions, transfers and withdrawals.

**Fiat**

Conventional money (fiduciary money), i.e. money that is not a cryptocurrency, such as euros, reals, dollars, etc.

**FOMO**

Fear of missing out or fear of missing out on a profitable opportunity.

**Fork**

Updates to the cryptocurrency codes of coins, called a fork. A new coin that emerges from another, such as Bitcoin Dash, which is a fork of Bitcoin.

**Full Node**

It is the program that contains the consensus rules of the Bitcoin network and a full copy of the blockchain. Not every full node is a miner, but every miner is a full node.

***G***

**Gas**

The term gas refers to a pricing mechanism on the Ethereum network. It calculates the fees for executing a transaction or a smart contract operation.

**Genesis Block**

The first block of Bitcoin, created by Satoshi Nakamoto.

**GPU**

Graphical Processing Unit. Chip for processing complex mathematical calculations required for running games and software that require a lot of graphics resources.

***H***

**Halving**

Bitcoin halving is the emissions reduction that occurs every 4 years, as defined in the code.

**Hash**

An algorithm used by the Bitcoin protocol and other cryptocurrencies to convert a large amount of information into a fixed-length hexadecimal string of numbers.

**Hash Rate**

Number of hashes processed by a miner in a given period of time.

**HOLD**

In Portuguese, it means "to hold", i.e. we hold the asset even in the event of a significant devaluation, thinking about future valuations.

**Hot wallet**

It is a cryptocurrency wallet that is online and connected to the Internet. Like Metamask, Binance wallet, Trust wallet, Phantom and many others.

**Hype**

A term that indicates that something is the trend of the moment. For example, "NFTs are in an absurd hype".

***I***

**ICO**

Initial Coin Offering is a system for raising funds for a startup or company. Usually they come up with "revolutionary or unique ideas" that are applied on a blockchain.

**IDO**

Initial Dex Offering, A IDO is a crypto token offering conducted on a decentralized exchange (DEX).

**INPUT**

Origin address of a bitcoin transaction. A single transaction can have multiple origin addresses.

***K***

***Kilohashes/second - kH/s***

Number of possible attempts to resolve a hash in a given second, measured in thousands of hashes.

***KYC***

Know your customer, in Portuguese. These are guidelines that government institutions impose on companies to find out who they are doing business with, i.e. they have data and documents of their customers.

***L***

**Ledger**

The ledger is a shared record of information, like a bank cash book, a book where all financial transactions in a bank are recorded, the ledger would be a place where transactions of cryptocurrencies running on the blockchain are recorded. . Today, it is also a wallet that allows cryptocurrencies to be stored without an internet connection.

**Liquidity**

It is the ability to buy or sell an asset easily, even in large quantities.

![Ledger used to store private keys securely.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/eqe_0q0uws5zc_0jzyNZl.png?height=438&width=500)

***M***

**Malleability**

Ability to change uncommitted transactions without invalidating them.

**Manufacturer**

Maker is a term used when you place an order and it is not immediately traded. The order stays on the order book waiting for someone else to send a counter order so it can be executed.

**Marketcap**

The famous market cap. Amount of cryptocurrency circulating X crypto price.

**Megahashes/sec - MH /s**

Number of possible attempts to resolve a hash in a given second, measured in millions of hashes.

**MicroBit - uBTC**

One millionth part of 1 Bitcoin or 0.000001 BTC.

**MilliBit - mBTC**

One thousandth part of 1 Bitcoin or 0.001 BTC.

**Mining**

This is the process of performing mathematical calculations. When a computer performs these cryptographic calculations, it receives a reward, X Bitcoin. We say that it mines and creates more Bitcoin.

**Mixer**

Service that encrypts the input and output of transactions to maintain privacy and reduce traceability.

***N***

**Node**

Device connected to the Bitcoin network that uses a computer program to forward transactions to other nodes, creating a decentralized network.

***O***

**Order:**

Market order that executes the purchase regardless of the price.

STOP -LIMIT orde - You choose a price and tell the system: "When the currency reaches X dollars, place an order LIMIT for Y dollars".

**Output**

Destination address for a bitcoin transaction. It is possible for a transaction to have multiple outputs.

***P***

**P2P**

P2P (Peer-to-Peer). Bitcoin was designed as a peer-to-peer system, meaning it does not need intermediaries, such as central banks, to broker a transaction between two people. In the market, this term is used to describe the trading of cryptocurrencies between two parties without the need for an exchange.

**Paper wallet**

It is considered a very safe way to store your cryptocurrencies, as they are not exposed to much risk precisely because they are offline. Since you do not need access to the Internet, it's basically a piece of paper that contains your private and public keys.

**Phishing**

In phishing, the user clicks on or downloads a fake file to steal information. Due to the popularity of cryptocurrencies, fake emails, files that change the victim's router settings or Google ads are spread more and more often to make the site appear first.

**Pool**

A collection of miners who join together to mine a block, and then divide the rewards among themselves. Mining pools are a great way to increase the probability of success as the difficulty increases.

**PoW**

It is the proof that a transaction has been validated and is legitimate. Using a mathematical function (SHA -256), transactions are encrypted and sent to the network where miners compete to decrypt them.

**Profit**

When we buy/ sell crypto and make profits.

**Pump**

When the price of a currency goes up.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3yfkb1zB1zKx5CtrUtCRZ.png?height=576&width=1024)

***R***

**Rekt**

The correct term would be "Wrecked", which means "ruined". It is the investor who has lost everything and ruined his equity when the price falls.

**ROI**

The return on an investment.

***s***

**Satoshi**

Smallest part of a Bitcoin = 0.00000001 BTC. If someone says they have 10 Satoshis, it means they have 0.00000010 BTC.

**Satoshi Nakamoto**

The name of the alleged inventor of Bitcoin.

**Scam**

Scams and frauds that are very common in cryptocurrency projects.

**ScamCoin**

Altcoin created with the purpose of defrauding users and enriching creators.

**SEPA**

Single European Payments Area, Portuguese, Single European Payments Area, is an integrated payment system between the countries of the Eurozone that allows the transfer of funds between banks and different countries. The transfer process is similar to the TED /DOC that we have in Brazil, but in the case of SEPA it includes all countries that use the euro.

**SHA-256**

Hash-like mathematical function used in Bitcoin in various contexts, including during the mining process.

**ShitCoin**

This term is used to classify fraud coins with little or no standing in the community.

**Smart Contract**

A smart contract - also known as a smart contract or digital contract - is a self-executing computer code designed to facilitate, execute, and protect financial transactions on the blockchain.

**Spread**

Difference between the buy price and the sell price in the order book (book).

**Soft fork**

Update of a coin that does not require the coin system to be restarted with a new blockchain. This usually happens without us noticing.

**swingtrader**

Trading strategy with few operations over time. Take advantage of the market fluctuations.

***T***

**taker**

Taker is the investor who has an order that will be executed immediately if he finds another opposing order.

**Target Tag**

Target tag is a code assigned to each xrp account. It is used to identify the recipient of the transaction, as if it were your house number when an order is delivered.

**Terahashes/sec - TH /s**

Number of possible attempts to resolve a hash in a given second, measured in trillions of hashes (TH /s).

**testnet**

An alternative network used for test development.

**Ticker**
This is the name given to currency symbols: BTC (Bitcoin), ETH (Ethereum), LTC (Litecoin), XRP (Ripple), ADA (Cardano).

**Token**

Cryptocurrencies are coins created to be coins, while tokens are created to be distributed to people with the promise of being worth something in the future. Comparing the two to the conventional investment market, cryptocurrencies could be currencies like USD or EURO, while tokens would be the shares of a company.

**TOR**

Acronym for The Onion Router, in Portuguese. It is a routing protocol used by people who want to maintain their privacy on the net.

**TXID**

Better known as the transaction hash. This is an identifier used to reference transactions in a blockchain.

***V***

**Volatility**

Price movements of an asset.

**W**

Wallet

Wallet is where we can store digital currencies.

**Whale**

As the holder of a large portion of a given currency, the whale is a user that centralizes the currency by controlling its price.

**Withdraw**

Withdraw

***X***

**XBT**

Representation of the currency unit of bitcoin.

**XRP**

Ripple cryptocurrency ticker.

title: VIPs01 我们需要在田园上UGC
body:
我们在建设一个村子，位于浙江·太湖南部，靠近上海和杭州。村子有很多古宅，白墙黛瓦，清民风范，保留这样的气质，设计成古风文旅会有很好的沉浸感，应邀的来访者都有好感。这坚定了我们要悉心设计内容的决心。

内容建设和基建不同，集思广益，需要UGC，因此我们希望通过Web3协作共同展开叙事…

![正射影像](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/iSVa4Hg7CGGsrvw3oH-VL.jpg?height=500&width=1500)

150户古宅（宅基地）可以改造成商业集群运营20年。民宿、酒肆、茶馆、画廊、曲苑…清明上河繁荣，元宇宙实境。

![古法新酿](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/FT7d9xqakTqvVkBV9ExE_.jpg?height=692&width=1440)

古村2020年获得“美丽乡村”立项，桥梁、村道、植被、景观等基础环境改造已经启动。目前基础建设是以公司的组织形式开展的，具体情况会在后面新启篇幅以及AMA中解答。

![环境改造](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/O2cKza-N4ohf-o_DCSOiR.jpg?height=300&width=1500)

我们希望代入Web3机制的是“内容叙事”和“运营方式”，这两方面分别定义成“Storyliving”和“Time Bank”。

Storyliving一词来自于迪士尼在加州·奥兰多开发的商业地产项目。当全世界都在围绕Meta建设虚拟场景元宇宙的时候，地球上最会讲故事的公司--迪士尼表示，元宇宙应该是肉身住在童话小镇里，思绪荡漾在故事里。我们也认为，沉浸式的文旅小镇能够带给居住者丰富的生命体验，是贯穿于虚实的元宇宙平台。

Time Bank是流行于欧洲和北美的一种将“付出”(服务)储值的方式，人们之间的相互帮助，或者无形的付出可以被记录、转移、提取，这和基于区块链的数字经济十分相似，我们希望可以借此驱动小镇元宇宙生态。

因此，我们需要找到基于Web3运行机制的设计师、建筑师、规划师、园丁、文案、插画师、代码开发、社群运营、组织管理……并且大家的贡献可以被PoW。

“108 Wise Men”是我们发行在Opensea的NFT，是和贡献者建立联结的信牌。后期将用于登录平台，提交提案和投票等操作。也是未来回馈的凭证。

!["108 Wise Men" NFT](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/c3dBaFj3TVcStK9PZaNsh.jpg?height=2304&width=2778)

相关 Opensea 以及 Twitter 链接：

[https://opensea.io/collection/storyliving-time-bank](https://opensea.io/collection/storyliving-time-bank)

[https://twitter.com/Web3Village2022](https://twitter.com/Web3Village2022)

持有NFT拥有古村落生态的“创造权”，同时也是Web3乡村振兴社会实践的参与者，让我们共同协奏一曲赛博情怀的田园牧歌吧\~

title: What is The Tulua Project?
body:
Hello Friends,

We really appreciate everyone that has supported us to this point, we could not have done it without you. We are now entering into a new era of the The Tulua Project, which will be further explained in this article. To clarify, we are a creative blockchain company that strives to create a platform and franchise that revolves around exploring sound in all its expressions.  In order to do this, we have been slowly creating a world where Creatures of Sound can live in harmony with one another and communicate solely through vibrations and frequencies on their home, Tulua Island. The heart, represented by the Tulua shell, will be the only way Creatures of Sound can be born and enter Tulua Island. Each creature will have a unique shell for their avatar, which will represent how fragile and soft they are on the inside, yet hard and bold on the outside.

![Tulua Shell](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-K1KjBl2KN3kJo_ABrKkx.png?height=1412&width=1738)

In order to kick this project off, we will be creating different NFT Collections and short animated films to represent different elements of the world. The NFT collections will represent different aspects of the world while the short films will allow us to tell stories and create narratives in the world.  Pangea will be the first project we take on, which will explain the origin story of Tulua Island through the use of microscopic worlds and music. We eventually intend for this project to become a virtual world, however our main goal now is to focus on building the franchise and telling the story we have in mind. The end goal is to build a place where sound can be both explored and created with like-minded individuals.

There are three ways to gain access to this world and claim your own Creature of Sound:

**1 - Symphony DAO**

We understand that not everyone is financially able to mint an NFT, so we wanted to create a way through which someone can earn a shell, hence become a Creature of Sound in our world. Symphony DAO is The Tulua Projects’ mission to create a community of music producers and composers, where completing full compositions should be rewarded.

Earn $TULUA as a Music Composer and Producer

HOW IT WORKS:

1. Every week we post 2 prompts for music composers and producers to have as the framework for their compositions.
2. The deadline for submissions is by **9 PM PST on the respective Sunday that week**
3. The following week **$TULUA tokens** will be granted to those that have submitted their songs. **1 Prompted Composition Submission = 1 $TULUA Token** (Max $TULUA tokens one can receive per week are 2).
4. $TULUA Token earners will then receive rewards and credentials within The Tulua Project (What is The Tulua Project? More on that here)
5. The first season of $TULUA Tokens will run for a schedule of 8 weeks (May 30 - July 31) which means the maximum amount of $TULUA tokens you can earn in this first season is 16

To learn more about Symphony DAO please [click here](https://mirror.xyz/0x6C46354fD01B923F736178710abE32EA81b51Bb7/Ys4ZcJAtL2LS4uLb0ULcz418Vi8zDGNyKpSISpaY5JU). 

**2 - Owning a Dancer**

The Dancer collection was The Tulua Project’s first step into the web3 space. In the world we are creating, The Dancers will serve as a process from the Sonic Angels through which a Tulua Shell heart is born. The Dancers will not actually exist in the world, but as soon as a Dancer is minted, the color pigments will be extracted from it by the Sonic Angels in order to create a shell for the holders’ avatar. Thus birthing them as a Creature of Sound which will grant the holder access to Tulua Island.

![The Dancers](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XHyH5RN7RelOb-TOcDup8.jpeg?height=2000&width=2000)

**3 - Attending Events**

By attending Tulua events, one is able to work their way to earning a Creature of Sound. One is able to earn two tokens just by attending one event and needs a total of 6 tokens in order to qualify for a creature of sound.

![How to claim a Creature of Sound](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/BQtOI8m3ppt_cppEZT7iZ.png?height=1000&width=1000)

### Follow The Tulua Project here:

  <https://twitter.com/tuluaNFT>
* **Instagram:**

  <https://www.instagram.com/tuluaproject/>
