title: Migrating to the Seaport protocol
body:
Last week, [we unpacked the early details](https://opensea.io/blog/announcements/introducing-seaport-protocol/) of OpenSea’s new open-source protocol – Seaport – for the developer community. Seaport will become the foundation for OpenSea’s core products, unlocking a range of new use cases for creators, collectors, and the broader developer ecosystem. The protocol is non-custodial, non-upgradeable, and decentralized at its core — it belongs to the community first & foremost. And in that spirit, we’re inviting the community to join us in early testing via a $1M [Code4rena contest](https://code4rena.com/contests/2022-05-opensea-seaport-contest). 

The new Seaport protocol will open up a range of new paths for OpenSea and the developer ecosystem more broadly:

* A composable, open-source contract on top of which developers can build their own marketplaces
* The ability to create custom rulesets for the fulfillment of a listing or offer, using a concept called “zones”
* Support for multiple fees and custom creator fees
* Potential for new types of transactions: collection offers and batch fulfillment (including floor sweeping), batch listing, and more 

## Required changes for developers

As we migrate the OpenSea marketplace over to Seaport, there are a few implications to our APIs and SDK that will affect our existing developers.  When we initially launch the new protocol, we will operate Wyvern and Seaport in parallel for a period of one week following the launch - and this means that you’ll need to update your project in order to fetch and interact with orders from both contracts.

We’ve summarized the set of changes that are required in order for projects to be compatible with the new Seaport protocol when it launches on OpenSea in the coming weeks. If your project does not incorporate these updates, it will not be able to fetch or interact with offers or listings on the Seaport contract as we deploy it to our marketplace.

Here’s an overview of what to expect, with more details about each step in the sections that follow:

**Today (May 25)**

✅ **API:** Begin using new Seaport offers and listings endpoints on Testnets

✅ **API:** Begin parsing new Seaport orders from /assets and /bundles endpoints on Testnets

**Tomorrow (May 26)**

✅ **SDK:** Begin using new Seaport-ready functions in SDK v.4.0.0-beta on Testnets (May 26)

**Seaport live on OpenSea**

✅ **API:** Begin using new Seaport offers and listings endpoints on Mainnet

✅ **API:** Begin parsing new Seaport offers and listings from /assets and /bundles endpoints on Testnets

✅ **SDK:** Begin using new Seaport-ready functions in SDK v.4.0.0 on Mainnet

**Seaport live + 7 days**

✅ **API+ SDK:** Offers and listings can no longer be posted to [Wyvern v2.3 contract](https://etherscan.io/address/0x7f268357a8c2552623316e2562d90e642bb538e5)

**Seaport live + 30 days**

✅ **API + SDK:** Offers and listings can no longer be fetched from [Wyvern v2.3 contract](https://etherscan.io/address/0x7f268357a8c2552623316e2562d90e642bb538e5)

### OpenSea API

When we activate the new contract,[ our API](https://docs.opensea.io/reference/api-overview) will enable developers to fetch and post offers and listings from both the Wyvern and Seaport contracts. Since offers and listings from the new contract will differ from those on the Wyvern contract, developers will need to update their OpenSea API integrations to account for these differences. Current API implementations will continue to function against the Wyvern contract, however changes are required to fetch and post offers and listings from the new contract.

In order to be compatible with the Seaport contract, developers will need to make the following changes to their projects:

* Developers using the existing [/wyvern](https://docs.opensea.io/reference/retrieving-orders) endpoints will need to migrate to the new endpoint that supports offers and listings on the Seaport contract.
* Developers using the existing [/assets](https://docs.opensea.io/reference/getting-assets) and [/bundles](https://docs.opensea.io/reference/retrieving-bundles) endpoints will need to begin parsing orders from the Seaport contract that are returned from these endpoints. 

**Migrating from /wyvern endpoints to new Seaport orders endpoints**

With the launch of the Seaport contract, we will be deprecating the [/wyvern](https://docs.opensea.io/reference/retrieving-orders) endpoints - at this point, POST requests will no longer be supported and GET requests will only continue to function for 30 days post-launch.

The new Seaport offers and listings endpoints enable developers to create and fetch both listings and offers on the new contract.  Developers will need to begin using these new endpoints to interact with the Seaport contract moving forward.

Starting today, we have enabled support for these new endpoints on our Testnets API (Rinkeby) so that developers can begin to prepare for the migration. More details on these new endpoints can be found in our developer documentation:

* [Retrieve listings](https://docs.opensea.io/v2.0/reference/retrieve-listings-testnets)
* [Retrieve offers](https://docs.opensea.io/v2.0/reference/retrieve-offers-testnets)
* [Create a listing](https://docs.opensea.io/v2.0/reference/create-an-order-testnets)
* [Create an offer](https://docs.opensea.io/v2.0/reference/create-an-offer)

**Parsing Seaport orders from /assets and /bundles endpoints**

Since the format of Seaport orders differs from those on the Wyvern contract, we’re adding a new field to the [/assets](https://docs.opensea.io/reference/getting-assets) and [/bundles](https://docs.opensea.io/reference/retrieving-bundles) endpoints through which Seaport orders will be returned separately from Wyvern offers and listings.

Developers using these endpoints will need to update any parsing logic on the responses from these endpoints in order to specifically handle orders returned from the Seaport contract.  Each item in these responses will now include the `seaport_sell_orders` field, which will contain an array of listings from the Seaport contract on the NFT.

This new field matches the way in which Wyvern listings are currently returned through the existing `sell_orders` field:

`"asset": {` 
 `    …` 
 `    "sell_orders": [],` 
 `    "seaport_sell_orders": []` 
 `    …` 
 `}`

Once the Seaport contract is live on OpenSea, all new offers and listings that are created will be returned in the new `seaport_sell_orders` array.  As liquidity moves over to the new contract, you will see fewer and fewer listings being returned in the legacy `sell_orders` array, so we recommend that you cease to rely on this field after our forthcoming launch of Seaport on OpenSea.

### OpenSea SDK

Similar to the OpenSea API,[ our JavaScript SDK](https://projectopensea.github.io/opensea-js/) has been updated to support the fetching and posting of offers and listings on the new contract. Developers should plan to adopt Version 4.0.0 of our SDK when we launch Seaport on OpenSea and begin to use our new methods that have been updated to support orders on the new contract.

With this SDK update to support the new Seaport contract, there are notable changes that developers will need to address within their projects:

* All Wyvern-specific models will be deprecated in the new version of the SDK.  Wyvern support will be maintained through a legacy set of functions that developers can continue to use while the contract is still enabled on OpenSea.
* For each of these deprecated functions, we’re providing a new function that is compatible with orders on the new Seaport protocol.

With this upgrade to Version 4.0.0, the function names from Version 3.0.4 are now connected to the Seaport contract and will only begin to function when Seaport launches on OpenSea.  In order to preserve support for Wyvern, developers can use the following functions to maintain support for offers and listings on the Wyvern contract:

* `isOrderFulfillableLegacyWyvern`
* `cancelOrderLegacyWyvern`
* `fulfillOrderLegacyWyvern`
* `createBuyOrderLegacyWyvern`
* `createBundleBuyOrderLegacyWyvern`
* `createSellOrderLegacyWyvern`
* `createBundleSellOrderLegacyWyvern`
* `getCurrentPriceLegacyWyvern`
* `getOrderLegacyWyvern`

Starting on May 26, developers can begin testing against Version 4.0.0-beta on Rinkeby in order to prepare for the migration.

## Using the new contract

While our API and SDK provide helpful abstraction layers on top of the underlying contracts that we use here at OpenSea, we also realize that a growing part of the developer ecosystem is interested in building directly off of these contracts themselves. With the release of our new contract, we’re excited to expand our developer stack by opening up this contract for the entire ecosystem to build around and participate in its ongoing development.

If you’re interested in getting started, we’ve released a[ set of reference documentation](https://docs.opensea.io/v2.0/reference/seaport-overview) that you can use to learn more and begin building.

We also currently have a [two-week audit contest](https://code4rena.com/contests/2022-05-opensea-seaport-contest) running with code4rena with a $1 million prize pool, where we’d love participation from the community in reviewing the Seaport contracts. Please join us for the largest pool size in code4rena’s history!

title: Hello Mirror!
body:
My understanding of digital ownership changed quite abruptly in 2021. 

I was never much of a gamer, but there were still points in my life where I sunk hundreds of hours into titles like Clash of Clans; never *truly* considering the existential risk of losing my “in-game” property that comes with the architecture of the internet pre-blockchain era.

Elsewhere in the emerging metaverse, I was writing occasionally on web2 platforms, engaging in social networks, making memes, etc….

The common denominator is I’m not in true ownership of my work. And yes, I believe gameplay can be considered ‘work’ retrospectively.

One principle has become obvious to me:

> Just like in the physical world, the product of your time and effort on the internet can become an asset.

This is also affectionately known as the **Internet of Value** thesis.

Today, with the opening of the gates on Mirror where writers like myself can now freely publish onto the permaweb (Arweave) and verify authorship (Ethereum address), I feel myself taking one step forward in choosing to live in a digital economy where I can own my production.

I’m looking forward to posting **all** long-form writing I do in the future on a truly decentralized publication platform like this one. 

It’s weird to refer to a decentralized post as being “posted” anywhere. While the Mirror platform does have some assets tied to it, it’s such an open protocol that one does not even have to touch Mirror.xyz the website or its related resources (see Miguel’s musings on that [here](https://m1guelpf.blog/ofY4m25Sc-_LKy3BhRIQ0Dsf3Vz8FyB1EEy1kf8tXCk)).

Hello Mirror, until next time!

title: 走进Across系列3 — 发布和展望
body:
## 走进Across系列3 — 发布和展望

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3fk-Fe6eAJ0GKAnscb8xs.png?height=388&width=700)

这是我们的“跨越”系列的第三篇文章。错过了前面的部分？点击下方：

[第 1 部分](https://medium.com/across-protocol/getting-across-part-1-beginnings-a48174dc7827)| [第2部分](https://medium.com/across-protocol/getting-across-part-2-building-ba6f7ec15c84)

*概述： Across 团队在发布前完成了最后的收尾工作。这包括解决所有剩余的错误，以及使用户体验尽可能无缝。 Across 的发布非常成功，用户很满意，并且有大量的跨链转账。*

这是该系列的最后一篇文章：Across 团队正在准备 V2，V2很快将要到来并随着[巨大的LP流动性迁移。](https://medium.com/across-protocol/lps-migrate-liquidity-from-v1-to-v2-screenshots-and-faqs-8616150b3396)

在如此短的时间内创造出一个如此庞大的项目是很罕见的。

这两个月的转变伴随着成功与辛劳，但这所有一切都使协议恰到好处。

Across 快速转变的一个关键因素来自那些真正擅长他们所做的事情的人，他们专注于他们最擅长的事情。 设计团队成员没有从事社区任务，反之亦然。 后端工程师专注于后端，前端只专注于前端。 任何在创业公司工作过的人都知道所有人都有做所有事情的趋势。 避免这种情况可以让团队成员深入了解他们正在做的事情，专注于他们自己的赛道，以尽可能地制作出最好的产品。

### 收尾工作

Across 的合约是可靠且经过审计的，视觉效果也得到了检查。该协议已准备好启动。

设计负责人 Jesper 对发布前的成果充满信心。这个名字对协议来说很有意义，颜色和视觉效果完美地结合在一起。

在智能合约方面，上周需要进行了大修以尽可能降低gas成本。正如我们在[之前的文章](https://medium.com/across-protocol/getting-across-part-2-building-ba6f7ec15c84)中提到的，该团队成功地将中继器的成本从 1.4 mm单位的 gas 降低到了 200K 左右。这一成功来自一个减速带 — — 最初使用 OO 和 Across Protocol 的想法使事情变得昂贵。通过重新设计 Across 与 OO 的交互方式，团队找到了一种方法，使Across成为一座费用非常非常低的跨链桥。

[https://twitter.com/hashtag/BridgeForLess?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1522970775128580099%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fcdn.embedly.com%2Fwidgets%2Fmedia.html%3Ftype%3Dtext2Fhtmlkey%3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07schema%3Dtwitterurl%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Ftwitter.com%2Facrossprotocol%2Fstatus%2F1522970775128580099image%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Fi.embed.ly%2F1%2Fimage3Furl3Dhttps253A252F252Fabs.twimg.com252Ferrors252Flogo46x38.png26key3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07&src=hashtag_click](https://twitter.com/hashtag/BridgeForLess?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1522970775128580099%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fcdn.embedly.com%2Fwidgets%2Fmedia.html%3Ftype%3Dtext2Fhtmlkey%3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07schema%3Dtwitterurl%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Ftwitter.com%2Facrossprotocol%2Fstatus%2F1522970775128580099image%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Fi.embed.ly%2F1%2Fimage3Furl3Dhttps253A252F252Fabs.twimg.com252Ferrors252Flogo46x38.png26key3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07&src=hashtag_click)

与此同时，我们的前端工程师正在努力工作，确保最终版本得以完善并解决一切可能影响用户体验的问题

主要的前端目标：工作流运行良好，固若金汤。

对视觉效果进行了优化，“send”功能进行了测试，并且费用的计算方式也有很多微妙之处。

### 发布前的紧张

诚然，团队很紧张。这是该团队推出的第一个真正面向用户的产品。此前，UMA 的产品面向已经大量集成到 UMA 系统中的开发人员或用户。这座桥完全不同。

用户不需要具备丰富的技术知识，甚至根本不需要任何 UMA 知识，也能获得良好的体验。这很令人兴奋，但这也意味着会有更多的人关注该产品。

这促使 Across 团队用比平时更高的标准要求自己，确保用户体验流畅、简单且没有错误。

应该会出现从未听说过UMA或Across的人 — 团队希望确保他们的第一次体验是一流的。

### 起飞

辛勤的工作得到了回报。首席技术官Matt表示，他认为这是“UMA 有史以来最好的一次发布”。

该协议一上线就忙的不可开交，成功执行了没有重大的可用性或安全问题的转帐。一切都进行得非常顺利，用户很高兴。在发布后的第一周，我们的总交易量突破了1040万美元，拥有约700名独立用户，并进行了2次价值超过100万美元代币的独立交易。

当谈到社区时，人们出现并感兴趣；他们想建造。群体自然开始自行形成；令人惊讶的是，一个法律社区很早就出现了，并吸引了大量的律师！

看到如此多的人才来自我们的社区，这令人鼓舞。我们拥有出色的社区领袖、数据分析人员、开发人才、律师等等。

*“我喜欢成为 Across 的一员，因为在 Risk Labs 的指导下我拥有了一张白纸，让我能够协助建立一个强大和支持性的社区。我已经结交了一些长期的朋友，很期待看到我们在未来的成长和建设中会发生什么。”*

*- Mark，Across社区领袖*

另一个成功来了，而且仍然以我们的开发支持的形式出现。开发支持完全社区驱动的。即使 Across 桥牌的使用量增加，这支队伍也没有改变。

随着协议的发展，这种高水平的开发支持一直是闪亮的明星。人们喜欢 Across，即使事情进展不顺利，但由于支持的响应迅速，他们也喜欢 Across。我们收到了很多关于协议这方面的积极反馈。

除了我们的开发支持外，我们还收到了大量关于费用的积极反馈。我们经常收到关于我们的费用有多低的评论，尤其是一些巨鲸的评论。

[https://twitter.com/AcrossProtocol/status/1492552744384843779?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1492552744384843779%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fcdn.embedly.com%2Fwidgets%2Fmedia.html%3Ftype%3Dtext2Fhtmlkey%3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07schema%3Dtwitterurl%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Ftwitter.com%2Facrossprotocol%2Fstatus%2F1492552744384843779image%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Fi.embed.ly%2F1%2Fimage3Furl3Dhttps253A252F252Fabs.twimg.com252Ferrors252Flogo46x38.png26key3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07](https://twitter.com/AcrossProtocol/status/1492552744384843779?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1492552744384843779%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fcdn.embedly.com%2Fwidgets%2Fmedia.html%3Ftype%3Dtext2Fhtmlkey%3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07schema%3Dtwitterurl%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Ftwitter.com%2Facrossprotocol%2Fstatus%2F1492552744384843779image%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Fi.embed.ly%2F1%2Fimage3Furl3Dhttps253A252F252Fabs.twimg.com252Ferrors252Flogo46x38.png26key3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07)

作为一个新协议，我们的团队非常感激小型和大型用户都非常喜欢使用 Across。

我们的用户体验继续在我们展示费用明细的方式上得到称赞，这是 Across 独有的，也是我们对透明度承诺的一部分。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VfbcOEyNcrKpuZBGzHPSg.png?height=427&width=700)

总的来说，用户体验很好，而且效果很好。

### 一种可怕的兴奋

团队喜欢在 Across 上工作的很多事情。我们的设计负责人Jesper说，在Across上工作既“令人兴奋又令人恐惧”能直接接触到这么多的用户真是太棒了，但这也给每个人带来了很大的压力，他们必须确保一切顺利。

工程师 Nick 对 Across 有很多他喜欢的东西 — — 艺术作品、它是一个独立的产品的事实以及它展示我们软件强大功能的容易程度。对Nick来说，另一个吸引人的因素是能够从头开始构建一些东西。

Across社区成员 Giertta 表示，她喜欢自己成为创新和新事物一部分的感觉。Giertta 喜欢“了解和结识来自不同国家的人，这些人来通过 Across 聚集在一起。”

首席技术官Matt表示，他喜欢为消费者带来如此价值的工作。人们只是为功能而出现，无论他们是否关心 UMA、Across 代币等。他们看到了我们提供的东西的真正价值。

*“作为一名软件开发人员，知道自己写的东西让别人开心的感觉真好。”*

*- Matt Rice，首席技术官*

社区负责人 Britt 表示，她相信这是 UMA 在用户界面和体验方面最完善的产品。我们以前的许多产品都旨在成为开发人员工具，但这个完全是为最终用户开发的。到目前为止，第一个版本运行良好的事实表明，Across未来有很多机会。Across在 V1就已经声名鹊起了。

[https://twitter.com/AcrossProtocol/status/1515390619128152067/photo/1?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1515390619128152067%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fcdn.embedly.com%2Fwidgets%2Fmedia.html%3Ftype%3Dtext2Fhtmlkey%3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07schema%3Dtwitterurl%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Ftwitter.com%2Facrossprotocol%2Fstatus%2F1515390619128152067image%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Fi.embed.ly%2F1%2Fimage3Furl3Dhttps253A252F252Fabs.twimg.com252Ferrors252Flogo46x38.png26key3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07](https://twitter.com/AcrossProtocol/status/1515390619128152067/photo/1?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1515390619128152067%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fcdn.embedly.com%2Fwidgets%2Fmedia.html%3Ftype%3Dtext2Fhtmlkey%3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07schema%3Dtwitterurl%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Ftwitter.com%2Facrossprotocol%2Fstatus%2F1515390619128152067image%3Dhttps3A%2F%2Fi.embed.ly%2F1%2Fimage3Furl3Dhttps253A252F252Fabs.twimg.com252Ferrors252Flogo46x38.png26key3Da19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07)

发布后，Across 没有放缓速度的计划。正如首席技术官 Matt所说，“这个领域真的很有竞争力。那里有很多很好的跨链桥，在这样一个竞争激烈的环境中工作具有挑战性。我们必须在某些特定指标上做得更好。你不能依赖功能集，你必须更便宜、更快、更安全。”

### 期待V2

V1 发布后不久，我们的工程师就开始着手开发 V2，它的目标是成为一个功能强大、完全打包的产品。V2 旨在成为安全、廉价和快速跨链的一站式解决方案。V2 将每个人都牢记在心，从用户到中继器，其某些功能将使中继更易于访问，跨链更高效。

我们计划在 5 月 24 日星期二推出 V2。

我们的“走进Across”系列到此结束。感谢您的阅读 — — 我们希望您喜欢了解我们的团队以及我们为这款产品感到多么的自豪。

title: STEPN: Fad or The Future of Fitness?
body:
After publishing [my breakdown on blockchain gaming](https://mirror.xyz/amandayoung.eth/AoF1piq6kpFHX0TPTt0-7zsyveMgZdu5dEJIilDHABA), a number of people have asked “What are your thoughts on STEPN?” So, here they are!

In this post, I break down three key questions:

1. What is STEPN?
2. How Does STEPN’s Economy Currently Work?
3. Is STEPN’s Economy Sustainable?

## What is STEPN?

![Screenshots from STEPN's in-app sneaker marketplace](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/CqrZNYZ-X4cnXk1tdwxmv.jpg?height=2436&width=3375)

Per the [startup’s whitepaper](https://whitepaper.stepn.com/), “STEPN is a Web3 lifestyle app with inbuilt Game-Fi and Social-Fi elements.” To get started, users must purchase a sneaker from the app’s marketplace. Sneakers vary based on type (walker, runner, jogger, trainer), attributes (luck, efficiency, comfort, resilience), quality (common, uncommon, rare, epic, legendary), level, gem sockets (luck, efficiency, comfort, resilience), and shoe minting event (7 allowed per sneaker). As of May 2022, the cheapest sneaker is currently priced at \~13-14 SOL.

Since the public beta launch in Dec. 2021, STEPN has experienced rapid growth - all while the app has controlled demand through activation codes (only 1,000 issued per day). Per the company, STEPN has [two to three million monthly active users worldwide.](https://techcrunch.com/2022/05/22/play-move-to-earn-solana-stepn-gamefi/) Further, transaction volume and user growth [seems to have remained strong](https://dune.com/nguyentoan/STEPN-(GMT-GST)-Core-Metrics) despite an [overall market correction](https://www.forbes.com/sites/jonathanponciano/2022/05/11/crypto-winter-sparks-coinbase-stock-crash-as-bitcoin-ether-and-other-major-cryptocurrencies-crater/?sh=73841e827b62).

## How Does STEPN’s Economy Currently Work?

![STEPN's token vesting schedule](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/hMLnJvAyvfJgxfQqXlE-p.png?height=850&width=1964)

Per [STEPN’s whitepaper](https://whitepaper.stepn.com/), the app’s economy is based on a game token (GST) and governance token (GMT). GST supply is unlimited while GMT token supply is capped at 6 billion and deflationary with a halving every three years. Per [STEPN’s litepaper](https://stepn.com/litePaper), GMT allocation is as follows: 30% to move and earn, 30% to ecosystem/treasury, 16.3% to private sale, 14.2% to team, 7% to Binance Launchpad (public sale), and 2.5% to advisors. The team has developed an 8-year plan for tokenomics with private round tokens unlocking in 2023 and vesting over three years. [As Nat Eliason points out](https://crypto.nateliason.com/p/stepn?s=w), the slowness of the token emissions and 8-year-token planning shows that the team and investors are committed to the project for the long-term. However, they are still likely to significantly profit even in the case of a sharp downturn because of the probably low valuation for the team’s $5M seed round in Jan. 2022 ([current Fully Diluted Market Cap is over $1.5B](https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/gomining-token/)).

In the app, GST and GMT are rewarded for move-to-earn activities, with GMT earnings only available at level 30 or higher. GST is paid out every minute of movement, with the amount dependent on the type of sneaker, sneaker’s efficiency attribute, sneaker’s comfort attribute, and the speed of movement. Users have a daily energy cap, which can be increased by getting more or higher quality sneakers, as well as a daily token cap for GST (maxes out at 300 GST; no token cap for GMT). Users must spend GST to repair their sneakers and [increase their earning power (e.g., leveling up, upgrading gems, minting sneakers).](https://stepnofficial.medium.com/tokeonomics-at-stepn-ee08604e82f1)

STEPN takes a 6% fee (2% trading, 4% royalty) on every sale in its marketplace, resulting in the company currently [generating $3-5 million in net profits from trading fees per day and earning up to $100 million every month](https://techcrunch.com/2022/05/22/play-move-to-earn-solana-stepn-gamefi/). The 2% trading fee is reserved for operations while no less than 5% of the startup’s profit is given back to the STEPN ecosystem.

Per the [company’s blog](https://stepnofficial.medium.com/tokeonomics-at-stepn-ee08604e82f1), STEPN is agile in the management of the in-game economy to ensure the app is “both profitable for established players and price-friendly for newer players.” For example, STEPN introduced cooling mechanisms when GST hit a high of $9 from only being $4-5 a week earlier. In addition, STEPN [recently committed its Q1 profits of \~$26M to buyback and burn GMT](https://stepnofficial.medium.com/announcement-stepn-1st-quarterly-gmt-buyback-burn-8db6e1758eeb), which momentarily drove up prices to a [height of $3.94 before falling to the $1-1.50 range](https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/green-metaverse-token/) (also part of a broader market correction).

## Is STEPN’s Economy Sustainable?

![NFT sneakers from STEPN's partnership with ASICS](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/jwajTXNoPHG6bh3kjgQk1.jpeg?height=364&width=688)

I’m excited by the financial gamification of real-world activities like fitness and see long-term potential in this trend. My question is whether STEPN will have longevity or simply be an early experiment in a promising space. In its current state, STEPN’s economy is not sustainable in the medium-long term. However, the company is only in public beta with the opportunity to address key concerns. Below are areas for STEPN to focus on to successfully achieve its mission of inspiring millions to a healthier lifestyle leveraging Web3.

### Adjusted In-Game Tokenomics

STEPN’s in-game tokenomics are not sustainable. First, its current sinks are net inflationary - an issue pointed out by GameFi analysts at [Delphi Digital](https://twitter.com/Delphi_Digital/status/1522620679874441217) and [The Block](https://twitter.com/_calmdonut/status/1517867592811413504). Current sinks, such as buying socket upgrades, leveling up sneakers, or repairing sneakers, lead to increasing or restoring the emission rate of GST and GMT. Second, STEPN has a “runaway sneaker breeding problem,” which could result in the sneakers eventually losing their value - [as noted by Nat Eliason](https://crypto.nateliason.com/p/stepn?s=w). As Nat states, the end result of these two issues is a potential economic collapse due to insufficient new demand for sneakers resulting in falling sneaker prices or GST’s price falling due to too many people achieving top level sneakers with high earnings.

### Improved User Experience

[As Quirky Qwerty points out](https://twitter.com/QuirkyQwerty_/status/1495715146970415105), more players playing for the love of the game than to earn is critical for a game to be successful in the long-term. Having tried the app, I believe that the current user experience is inferior to comparable Web2 fitness apps (e.g., [Sweatcoin](https://sweatco.in/), [Strava](https://www.strava.com/)) in terms of tracking functionality (e.g., lack of metrics, such as calories, heart rate, elevation, etc. may not appeal to pro users), social features (e.g., no social feed or group challenges), and ease of use (e.g., limited sneaker marketplace discovery & curation, no notification that sneaker efficiency is dropping, separate wallet and spending accounts, etc.). In addition, continuing to enhance the app’s gamified design (e.g., mystery boxes, sneaker levels, energy optimization) will be key in ensuring players spend for the utility and fun of using STEPN, rather than just financial incentives. Per the [STEPN whitepaper](https://whitepaper.stepn.com/), the app plans to add social-fi elements, enhance gamification through achievement badges and quests, and improve onboarding through a sneaker rental system.

### External Cash Inflows

Ideally, STEPN can provide value to brands, organizations, and vendors. [As MapleLeafCap writes](https://twitter.com/MapleLeafCap/status/1490865490507427843), these external cash inflows could be used to either stabilize the economy or burn in-game currency in exchange. With the exception of a [partnership with Asics for NFT sneakers](https://cointelegraph.com/press-releases/stepn-successfully-launches-nft-sneakers-with-asics-on-binance-marketplace), STEPN has not yet implemented this strategy. Further, STEPN launched the Asics collection on the Binance NFT marketplace and thus trading fees have not fully benefited the STEPN ecosystem. New Chief Revenue Officer Mable Jiang plans to address this need for external cash inflows. [In her recent announcement of her decision to join the company](https://twitter.com/Mable_Jiang/status/1522751061374631936), she writes “the real question lies at how STEPN can bridge \*positive economic externalities\* into the system, and provide easy access for its community members to monetize from the proof of their physical work, their in-app time, and their attention.” Mable cites potential areas of partnership expansion, including brands, organizations that promote carbon offset and health, and local vendors. In the Web2 space, Sweatcoin, with its brand partnerships, sets an example for how STEPN might be able to improve its monetization.

title: Reality
body:
Our minds are not built to perceive reality

But a constant swirl of emotions and thoughts

Steering us away from perceived pain and towards salvation

Bifocals minimizing our worth, intensifying fear

To get out of this sad hole, we build

Our bodies, our stuff, our families, our companies 

We build to right the wrongs only we see within ourselves

The bigger the distortion, the grander the ambition

If we could only see and accept that we are human, 

that we are born worthy of love just for being

If we could feel our worth by just feeling

Society would grind to a halt, and we would all starve 

\:-)

![NFT sneakers from STEPN's partnership with ASICS](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/jwajTXNoPHG6bh3kjgQk1.jpeg?height=364&width=688)

I’m excited by the financial gamification of real-world activities like fitness and see long-term potential in this trend. My question is whether STEPN will have longevity or simply be an early experiment in a promising space. In its current state, STEPN’s economy is not sustainable in the medium-long term. However, the company is only in public beta with the opportunity to address key concerns. Below are areas for STEPN to focus on to successfully achieve its mission of inspiring millions to a healthier lifestyle leveraging Web3.

### Adjusted In-Game Tokenomics

STEPN’s in-game tokenomics are not sustainable. First, its current sinks are net inflationary - an issue pointed out by GameFi analysts at [Delphi Digital](https://twitter.com/Delphi_Digital/status/1522620679874441217) and [The Block](https://twitter.com/_calmdonut/status/1517867592811413504). Current sinks, such as buying socket upgrades, leveling up sneakers, or repairing sneakers, lead to increasing or restoring the emission rate of GST and GMT. Second, STEPN has a “runaway sneaker breeding problem,” which could result in the sneakers eventually losing their value - [as noted by Nat Eliason](https://crypto.nateliason.com/p/stepn?s=w). As Nat states, the end result of these two issues is a potential economic collapse due to insufficient new demand for sneakers resulting in falling sneaker prices or GST’s price falling due to too many people achieving top level sneakers with high earnings.

### Improved User Experience

[As Quirky Qwerty points out](https://twitter.com/QuirkyQwerty_/status/1495715146970415105), more players playing for the love of the game than to earn is critical for a game to be successful in the long-term. Having tried the app, I believe that the current user experience is inferior to comparable Web2 fitness apps (e.g., [Sweatcoin](https://sweatco.in/), [Strava](https://www.strava.com/)) in terms of tracking functionality (e.g., lack of metrics, such as calories, heart rate, elevation, etc. may not appeal to pro users), social features (e.g., no social feed or group challenges), and ease of use (e.g., limited sneaker marketplace discovery & curation, no notification that sneaker efficiency is dropping, separate wallet and spending accounts, etc.). In addition, continuing to enhance the app’s gamified design (e.g., mystery boxes, sneaker levels, energy optimization) will be key in ensuring players spend for the utility and fun of using STEPN, rather than just financial incentives. Per the [STEPN whitepaper](https://whitepaper.stepn.com/), the app plans to add social-fi elements, enhance gamification through achievement badges and quests, and improve onboarding through a sneaker rental system.

### External Cash Inflows

Ideally, STEPN can provide value to brands, organizations, and vendors. [As MapleLeafCap writes](https://twitter.com/MapleLeafCap/status/1490865490507427843), these external cash inflows could be used to either stabilize the economy or burn in-game currency in exchange. With the exception of a [partnership with Asics for NFT sneakers](https://cointelegraph.com/press-releases/stepn-successfully-launches-nft-sneakers-with-asics-on-binance-marketplace), STEPN has not yet implemented this strategy. Further, STEPN launched the Asics collection on the Binance NFT marketplace and thus trading fees have not fully benefited the STEPN ecosystem. New Chief Revenue Officer Mable Jiang plans to address this need for external cash inflows. [In her recent announcement of her decision to join the company](https://twitter.com/Mable_Jiang/status/1522751061374631936), she writes “the real question lies at how STEPN can bridge \*positive economic externalities\* into the system, and provide easy access for its community members to monetize from the proof of their physical work, their in-app time, and their attention.” Mable cites potential areas of partnership expansion, including brands, organizations that promote carbon offset and health, and local vendors. In the Web2 space, Sweatcoin, with its brand partnerships, sets an example for how STEPN might be able to improve its monetization.

title: Poseidon DAO Genesis Project
body:
In line with its value proposition, [Poseidon DAO](https://twitter.com/Poseidon_SF) announced the launch of Genesis artworks.

After the success of the sale of the first[ derivative artwork](https://foundation.app/collection/posder), in collaboration with Niro Perrone, Poseidon DAO is about to launch its first Genesis artwork in collaboration with [Cracking Art](http://www.crackingart.com/).

## What is the Genesis project?

As already mentioned previously[ in this article](https://mirror.xyz/0x4Ac0eaC004c87e43a8D52CAC8B431FEaFBb9B62b/KVkL_nI4_A2WqZLuSuzuUs9djmlzWzVCoKL-irQVpaM), in order to create value for its token holders and bring as much benefit as possible to the NFT ecosystem in general, Poseidon DAO is committed to selecting talented artists and photographers who come from the so-called traditional art world to accompany them in the art world on blockchain.

Nowadays, in fact, the world of traditional art and NFT still speak too little: Poseidon DAO is therefore proposed as a bridge between the two worlds, facilitating the entry of physical artists in the art world on blockchain, giving them prominence through their own social media and making them known in the crypto environment, often ignorant of traditional art. Not only that: if necessary, the board of Poseidon is ready to guide the selected artists step by step in the sale of their works.

## What is Cracking Art

The first partnership of the Genesis project is with Cracking art, a collective known all over the world for its installations of different colored plastic animals in the most varied places. The artistic conception of cracking art is so explained: "*The name "[Cracking Art](http://www.crackingart.com/en/the-group/philosophy/)" comes from the English verb "to crack", which expresses the state of being split, broken, cracked, or crashed. This catalytic cracking, as the name suggests, is also the term for the chemical reaction that occurs when converting raw crude oil into plastic. For the artists, it represents the instant when something natural becomes artificial and is the reason why they seek to seize that very moment in their art form*." Ecological and environmental issues are very important for the collective: it is no coincidence that the first NFT is called SOS World and represents a futuristic Venice, submerged by water where plastic turtles swim. 

The Cracking Art NFT will be undermined on Thursday, May 26 through [the Poseidon DAO foundation account](https://foundation.app/collection/psdg). Also in this case, as with the BAYC 5899 derivative, during the auction, all bidders will be eligible for receiving Poseidon DAO tokens in airdrop in their wallet. Further updates will follow on our [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Poseidon_SF) and [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/H9jrvSwuRV) pages

## Upcoming artists of the Genesis project

In addition to Cracking Art, three other artists will be launched as part of the Genesis project: [Paulo Renftle](http://www.renftle.com/), a photographer famous for many big brands advertising campaigns, from luxury watches to luxury cars, [Marco Grassi](http://www.marcograssi.me/), a painter who manages to expose the female soul in metal plates and Davide Jelmini, a naturalist photographer who, creates abstract images with a strong visual impact by mirroring his photographs.

title: On EIP-4844 and it's impact on Ethereum scalability
body:
All the talk in the Ethereum community these days is about the merge. It's the most anticipated protocol upgrade and will be a critical event in crypto history. Nevertheless, core developers are already planning for the next big thing, and this time will be all about **scalability**.

![from \[vital's blogpost about sharding\](https://vitalik.ca/general/2021/04/07/sharding.html)](https://cdn.hashnode.com/res/hashnode/image/upload/v1653503727474/XoPsdJYuY.png)

The Ethereum roadmap has featured **sharding** as a scalability improvement for quite some time now and the time for it to make it into the core protocol is getting close.

The actual implementation of sharding has changed a lot since it was first conceived though, the current one is called **danksharding** (dank from its proposer *dankrad*) and it's designed to make its implementation less complex than it would otherwise be.

Nevertheless, it'll still require lots of work and that's where EIP-4844 or, as it's more commonly known, **proto-danksharding** (proto from its proposer, *protolamda*) comes in. Proto-danksharding will both pave the way to danksharding implementation and increase layer 2 scalability, especially for rollups. ### Rollups and their data Rollups work by executing transactions off-chain, relieving the base layer from this computation; but they still need to post the data about these transactions on chain and this is exaclty the main bottleneck  keeping the fees high for the end-user because permently storing data on Ethereum is quite expensive.

Rollups currently use **calldata** to post their data on-chain and, as I've noted earlier, this uses a lot of gas and that's why transaction fees on rollups are still not dirt cheap.

## Meet the blobs

Proto-danksharding will introduce a new transaction type: **blob-carrying transaction**.

A "blob" is a big piece of data which is much more cheap to publish and store on Ethereum than calldata. By using blob-carrying transactions rollups can upload their all their data to Ethereum paying less and ultimately charging lower fees to users.

#### But how are blobs cheaper than calldata?

Well currently, every transaction fee on Ethereum is priced according to the gas price market in auction-style: who bids more gets their transaction included in a block first. After proto-danksharding blob-carrying transactions won't partecipate in the same fee market as other transactions; instead a **multidimesional fee market** is implemented and the gas used to pay for blob txs will have a separate pricing from the gas used to pay for standard transactions.

#### Won't this dramatically increase the Ethereum blockchain size though?

Yes and no actually.
After EIP-4844 average block size will grow from 84KB to 1MB (more than a 10x increase) but there a catch: the data contained in the blocks will be **stored only for 30 days** by the nodes. In fact the goal of publishing this data on Ethereum is not to have it permanently available on the blockchain, but to guarantee that it has been available for a sufficient amount of time for external entities (such as block explorer, full storage nodes, rollup sequencers) to ensure its validity and, possibly, download it.

#### How much will fees lower on layer 2s?

After EIP-4844 is implemented and after rollups upgrade to support the new parameters, we could se a **10-100x decrease** in transaction fees in both optimistic and zk-rollups. A truly massive scalability improvement needed to make these platform usable for everyday users.

### Paving the way for danksharding

Danksharding will be built upon the upgrades and implementation of EIP-4844. This kind of sharding will only affect the new blob-carrying transactions and their fee market.
Ultimately, it's like the Ethereum core devs are providing us with a foretaste of what is later to come.

title: Lost
body:
```
We run marathons to be still; 
we build cities to be alone.

We waste time to be productive; 
we waste money to get rich.

We create noise to find signal; 
we create drama to find calm.

We propagate hate to signal virtue; 
we hurt loved ones in pursuit of love.

We empower dictators to foster freedom; 
we fight wars to protect peace.

We use control to teach agency; 
we use dogma to teach creativity.

We seek validation to find purpose; 
we reaffirm biases to grow.

We drug ourselves to get clear; 
we lie to ourselves to tell the truth.

There are two parts within each of us, 
working for us and against each other.

Divided by the ego, united by the self, 
but repelling one another to keep us sane.

We have this illusion of control, 
we think we know ourselves.

But if we aren’t aware of their conflict 
and learn to love each part,

They will run us against ourselves, 
and we’ll be forever lost.
```

title: STEPN: Fad or The Future of Fitness?

In this post, I break down three key questions:

![Screenshots from STEPN's in-app sneaker marketplace](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/CqrZNYZ-X4cnXk1tdwxmv.jpg?height=2436&width=3375)

Per the [startup’s whitepaper](https://whitepaper.stepn.com/), “STEPN is a Web3 lifestyle app with inbuilt Game-Fi and Social-Fi elements.” To get started, users must purchase a sneaker from the app’s marketplace. Sneakers vary based on type (walker, runner, jogger, trainer), attributes (luck, efficiency, comfort, resilience), quality (common, uncommon, rare, epic, legendary), level, gem sockets (luck, efficiency, comfort, resilience), and shoe minting event (7 allowed per sneaker). As of May 2022, the cheapest sneaker is currently priced at \~13-14 SOL.

Since the public beta launch in Dec. 2021, STEPN has experienced rapid growth - all while the app has controlled demand through activation codes (only 1,000 issued per day). Per the company, STEPN has [two to three million monthly active users worldwide.](https://techcrunch.com/2022/05/22/play-move-to-earn-solana-stepn-gamefi/) Further, transaction volume and user growth [seems to have remained strong](https://dune.com/nguyentoan/STEPN-(GMT-GST)-Core-Metrics) despite an [overall market correction](https://www.forbes.com/sites/jonathanponciano/2022/05/11/crypto-winter-sparks-coinbase-stock-crash-as-bitcoin-ether-and-other-major-cryptocurrencies-crater/?sh=73841e827b62).

![STEPN's token vesting schedule](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/hMLnJvAyvfJgxfQqXlE-p.png?height=850&width=1964)

Per [STEPN’s whitepaper](https://whitepaper.stepn.com/), the app’s economy is based on a game token (GST) and governance token (GMT). GST supply is unlimited while GMT token supply is capped at 6 billion and deflationary with a halving every three years. Per [STEPN’s litepaper](https://stepn.com/litePaper), GMT allocation is as follows: 30% to move and earn, 30% to ecosystem/treasury, 16.3% to private sale, 14.2% to team, 7% to Binance Launchpad (public sale), and 2.5% to advisors. title: 企业家是最乐观的人群
body:
企业家绝对是人群里最乐观的人，哪怕接下来很大程度上可预见的经济状况会有多差，这帮人还在坚持着搞工厂生产为市场提供商品服务。

 你得佩服这些人的勇气，何况经济状况差的时候，很多行业几乎九死一生，脚步稍微迈错死的就是自己。 你说这些人为什么哪怕赚够财富自由的钱了还要这么死磕，而不是守住财富全身而退或去投资其他收益率更高的行业。我想这就是他们的可贵之处。虽然有些企业家是因为除了搞自己行业的生产制造完全不懂其他的，所以唯有继续去走那条路。可很多也真的仅仅就是因为乐观还有其它一些企业家精神而继续死磕的。 

想下，如果人人都悲观去关掉企业，那情况就会更糟糕，我们的日常用品都会变得稀缺。 所以，悲观里给自己留下乐观真的很重要，再困难的状况，也有赚到钱的行业赚到钱的企业家，如若人人悲观，那情况只会更糟糕。

title: STEPN: Fad or The Future of Fitness?
body:
After publishing [my breakdown on blockchain gaming](https://mirror.xyz/amandayoung.eth/AoF1piq6kpFHX0TPTt0-7zsyveMgZdu5dEJIilDHABA), a number of people have asked “What are your thoughts on STEPN?” So, here they are!

In this post, I break down three key questions:

1. What is STEPN?
2. How Does STEPN’s Economy Currently Work?
3. Is STEPN’s Economy Sustainable?

## What is STEPN?

![Screenshots from STEPN's in-app sneaker marketplace](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/CqrZNYZ-X4cnXk1tdwxmv.jpg?height=2436&width=3375)

Per the [startup’s whitepaper](https://whitepaper.stepn.com/), “STEPN is a Web3 lifestyle app with inbuilt Game-Fi and Social-Fi elements.” To get started, users must purchase a sneaker from the app’s marketplace. Sneakers vary based on type (walker, runner, jogger, trainer), attributes (luck, efficiency, comfort, resilience), quality (common, uncommon, rare, epic, legendary), level, gem sockets (luck, efficiency, comfort, resilience), and shoe minting event (7 allowed per sneaker). As of May 2022, the cheapest sneaker is currently priced at \~13-14 SOL.

Since the public beta launch in Dec. 2021, STEPN has experienced rapid growth - all while the app has controlled demand through activation codes (only 1,000 issued per day). Per the company, STEPN has [two to three million monthly active users worldwide.](https://techcrunch.com/2022/05/22/play-move-to-earn-solana-stepn-gamefi/) Further, transaction volume and user growth [seems to have remained strong](https://dune.com/nguyentoan/STEPN-(GMT-GST)-Core-Metrics) despite an [overall market correction](https://www.forbes.com/sites/jonathanponciano/2022/05/11/crypto-winter-sparks-coinbase-stock-crash-as-bitcoin-ether-and-other-major-cryptocurrencies-crater/?sh=73841e827b62).

## How Does STEPN’s Economy Currently Work?

![STEPN's token vesting schedule](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/hMLnJvAyvfJgxfQqXlE-p.png?height=850&width=1964)

Per [STEPN’s whitepaper](https://whitepaper.stepn.com/), the app’s economy is based on a game token (GST) and governance token (GMT). GST supply is unlimited while GMT token supply is capped at 6 billion and deflationary with a halving every three years. Per [STEPN’s litepaper](https://stepn.com/litePaper), GMT allocation is as follows: 30% to move and earn, 30% to ecosystem/treasury, 16.3% to private sale, 14.2% to team, 7% to Binance Launchpad (public sale), and 2.5% to advisors. The team has developed an 8-year plan for tokenomics with private round tokens unlocking in 2023 and vesting over three years. [As Nat Eliason points out](https://crypto.nateliason.com/p/stepn?s=w), the slowness of the token emissions and 8-year-token planning shows that the team and investors are committed to the project for the long-term. However, they are still likely to significantly profit even in the case of a sharp downturn because of the probably low valuation for the team’s $5M seed round in Jan. 2022 ([current Fully Diluted Market Cap is over $1.5B](https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/gomining-token/)).

In the app, GST and GMT are rewarded for move-to-earn activities, with GMT earnings only available at level 30 or higher. GST is paid out every minute of movement, with the amount dependent on the type of sneaker, sneaker’s efficiency attribute, sneaker’s comfort attribute, and the speed of movement. Users have a daily energy cap, which can be increased by getting more or higher quality sneakers, as well as a daily token cap for GST (maxes out at 300 GST; no token cap for GMT). Users must spend GST to repair their sneakers and [increase their earning power (e.g., leveling up, upgrading gems, minting sneakers).](https://stepnofficial.medium.com/tokeonomics-at-stepn-ee08604e82f1)

STEPN takes a 6% fee (2% trading, 4% royalty) on every sale in its marketplace, resulting in the company currently [generating $3-5 million in net profits from trading fees per day and earning up to $100 million every month](https://techcrunch.com/2022/05/22/play-move-to-earn-solana-stepn-gamefi/). The 2% trading fee is reserved for operations while no less than 5% of the startup’s profit is given back to the STEPN ecosystem.

Per the [company’s blog](https://stepnofficial.medium.com/tokeonomics-at-stepn-ee08604e82f1), STEPN is agile in the management of the in-game economy to ensure the app is “both profitable for established players and price-friendly for newer players.” For example, STEPN introduced cooling mechanisms when GST hit a high of $9 from only being $4-5 a week earlier. In addition, STEPN [recently committed its Q1 profits of \~$26M to buyback and burn GMT](https://stepnofficial.medium.com/announcement-stepn-1st-quarterly-gmt-buyback-burn-8db6e1758eeb), which momentarily drove up prices to a [height of $3.94 before falling to the $1-1.50 range](https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/green-metaverse-token/) (also part of a broader market correction).

## Is STEPN’s Economy Sustainable?

![NFT sneakers from STEPN's partnership with ASICS](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/jwajTXNoPHG6bh3kjgQk1.jpeg?height=364&width=688)

I’m excited by the financial gamification of real-world activities like fitness and see long-term potential in this trend. My question is whether STEPN will have longevity or simply be an early experiment in a promising space. In its current state, STEPN’s economy is not sustainable in the medium-long term. However, the company is only in public beta with the opportunity to address key concerns. Below are areas for STEPN to focus on to successfully achieve its mission of inspiring millions to a healthier lifestyle leveraging Web3.

### Adjusted In-Game Tokenomics

STEPN’s in-game tokenomics are not sustainable. First, its current sinks are net inflationary - an issue pointed out by GameFi analysts at [Delphi Digital](https://twitter.com/Delphi_Digital/status/1522620679874441217) and [The Block](https://twitter.com/_calmdonut/status/1517867592811413504). Current sinks, such as buying socket upgrades, leveling up sneakers, or repairing sneakers, lead to increasing or restoring the emission rate of GST and GMT. Second, STEPN has a “runaway sneaker breeding problem,” which could result in the sneakers eventually losing their value - [as noted by Nat Eliason](https://crypto.nateliason.com/p/stepn?s=w). As Nat states, the end result of these two issues is a potential economic collapse due to insufficient new demand for sneakers resulting in falling sneaker prices or GST’s price falling due to too many people achieving top level sneakers with high earnings.

### Improved User Experience

[As Quirky Qwerty points out](https://twitter.com/QuirkyQwerty_/status/1495715146970415105), more players playing for the love of the game than to earn is critical for a game to be successful in the long-term. Having tried the app, I believe that the current user experience is inferior to comparable Web2 fitness apps (e.g., [Sweatcoin](https://sweatco.in/), [Strava](https://www.strava.com/)) in terms of tracking functionality (e.g., lack of metrics, such as calories, heart rate, elevation, etc. may not appeal to pro users), social features (e.g., no social feed or group challenges), and ease of use (e.g., limited sneaker marketplace discovery & curation, no notification that sneaker efficiency is dropping, separate wallet and spending accounts, etc.). In addition, continuing to enhance the app’s gamified design (e.g., mystery boxes, sneaker levels, energy optimization) will be key in ensuring players spend for the utility and fun of using STEPN, rather than just financial incentives. Per the [STEPN whitepaper](https://whitepaper.stepn.com/), the app plans to add social-fi elements, enhance gamification through achievement badges and quests, and improve onboarding through a sneaker rental system.

### External Cash Inflows

Ideally, STEPN can provide value to brands, organizations, and vendors. [As MapleLeafCap writes](https://twitter.com/MapleLeafCap/status/1490865490507427843), these external cash inflows could be used to either stabilize the economy or burn in-game currency in exchange. With the exception of a [partnership with Asics for NFT sneakers](https://cointelegraph.com/press-releases/stepn-successfully-launches-nft-sneakers-with-asics-on-binance-marketplace), STEPN has not yet implemented this strategy. Further, STEPN launched the Asics collection on the Binance NFT marketplace and thus trading fees have not fully benefited the STEPN ecosystem. New Chief Revenue Officer Mable Jiang plans to address this need for external cash inflows. [In her recent announcement of her decision to join the company](https://twitter.com/Mable_Jiang/status/1522751061374631936), she writes “the real question lies at how STEPN can bridge \*positive economic externalities\* into the system, and provide easy access for its community members to monetize from the proof of their physical work, their in-app time, and their attention.” Mable cites potential areas of partnership expansion, including brands, organizations that promote carbon offset and health, and local vendors. In the Web2 space, Sweatcoin, with its brand partnerships, sets an example for how STEPN might be able to improve its monetization.

If you have feedback/comments or want to exchange thoughts on the future of X-to-earn, [I’m excited to chat](https://twitter.com/0xAmandaYoung)!

title: Mirrorの新機能
body:
**Mirrorが文書型NFTをリリース**

つい先日、Web3文書作成サービスの[Mirror](https://twitter.com/viamirror)が、執筆した文章をNFTとして保存し、供給枚数を決めて発行できる新機能をリリースしました。この記事では新機能の詳細と、今後のWeb3空間に及ぼしうる影響について所感を述べていきます。 
 

**新たに提供された機能**

・ダッシュボードからのNFT発行機能

・MirrorDAOの記事[まとめ](https://dao.mirror.xyz/collection)

・人気記事の一覧が確認できる[リーダーボード](https://mirror.xyz/leaderboard)

[https://dao.mirror.xyz/collection](https://dao.mirror.xyz/collection)

既にMirrorを使って執筆した文章をNFTとして発行する機能は存在しましたが、今回の最も特徴的なアップデートは**「NFTを発行する時に価格と発行枚数を決められる」**点でしょう。

記事をPublishする際に以下のような画面が現れ、

例えば価格を0.01ETHで供給枚数を100枚と設定できるようになりました。

NFTを発行する側（執筆者）はNFTを無料で発行でき、記事の閲覧者はそれを購入して自身のコレクションページに表示させることができます。

![NFT発行画面](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-RDj4D4A32dMQ6fJh_Mij.png?height=832&width=708)

**Medium**と**OpenSea**の性質を取り入れた、というイメージです。

これにより、特定の人物のMirrorコレクションページを見ることで、その人物が何に興味を持っているか、どういったアイデアに共感しているのか、どのような記事を読んでいるのかが、本棚を見るように一目でわかるようになります。 
  
 Mirrorの初記事

title: Lost
body:
```
We run marathons to be still; 
we build cities to be alone.

We waste time to be productive; 
we waste money to get rich.

We create noise to find signal; 
we create drama to find calm.

We propagate hate to signal virtue; 
we hurt loved ones in pursuit of love.

We empower dictators to foster freedom; 
we fight wars to protect peace.

We use control to teach agency; 
we use dogma to teach creativity.

We seek validation to find purpose; 
we reaffirm biases to grow.

We drug ourselves to get clear; 
we lie to ourselves to tell the truth.

There are two parts within each of us, 
working for us and against each other.

Divided by the ego, united by the self, 
but repelling one another to keep us sane.

We have this illusion of control, 
we think we know ourselves.

But if we aren’t aware of their conflict 
and learn to love each part,

They will run us against ourselves, 
and we’ll be eternally lost.
```

title: Poseidon DAO Genesis Project
body:
In line with its value proposition, [Poseidon DAO](https://twitter.com/Poseidon_SF) announced the launch of Genesis artworks.

After the success of the sale of the first[ derivative artwork](https://foundation.app/collection/posder), in collaboration with Niro Perrone, Poseidon DAO is about to launch its first Genesis artwork in collaboration with [Cracking Art](http://www.crackingart.com/).

## What is the Genesis project?

As already mentioned previously[ in this article](https://mirror.xyz/0x4Ac0eaC004c87e43a8D52CAC8B431FEaFBb9B62b/KVkL_nI4_A2WqZLuSuzuUs9djmlzWzVCoKL-irQVpaM), in order to create value for its token holders and bring as much benefit as possible to the NFT ecosystem in general, Poseidon DAO is committed to selecting talented artists and photographers who come from the so-called traditional art world to accompany them in the art world on blockchain.

Nowadays, in fact, the world of traditional art and NFT still speak too little: Poseidon DAO is therefore proposed as a bridge between the two worlds, facilitating the entry of physical artists in the art world on blockchain, giving them prominence through their own social media and making them known in the crypto environment, often ignorant of traditional art. Not only that: if necessary, the board of Poseidon is ready to guide the selected artists step by step in the sale of their works.

![Cracking Art preview](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/H6mikC0d2wTICX7S_bdav.jpg?height=6464&width=9360)

## What is Cracking Art

The first partnership of the Genesis project is with Cracking art, a collective known all over the world for its installations of different colored plastic animals in the most varied places. The artistic conception of cracking art is so explained: "*The name "[Cracking Art](http://www.crackingart.com/en/the-group/philosophy/)" comes from the English verb "to crack", which expresses the state of being split, broken, cracked, or crashed. This catalytic cracking, as the name suggests, is also the term for the chemical reaction that occurs when converting raw crude oil into plastic. For the artists, it represents the instant when something natural becomes artificial and is the reason why they seek to seize that very moment in their art form*." Ecological and environmental issues are very important for the collective: it is no coincidence that the first NFT is called SOS World and represents a futuristic Venice, submerged by water where plastic turtles swim.

The Cracking Art NFT will be undermined on Thursday, May 26 through [the Poseidon DAO foundation account](https://foundation.app/collection/psdg). Also in this case, as with the BAYC 5899 derivative, during the auction, all bidders will be eligible for receiving Poseidon DAO tokens in airdrop in their wallet. Further updates will follow on our [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Poseidon_SF) and [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/H9jrvSwuRV) pages

## Upcoming artists of the Genesis project

In addition to Cracking Art, three other artists will be launched as part of the Genesis project: [Paulo Renftle](http://www.renftle.com/), a photographer famous for many big brands advertising campaigns, from luxury watches to luxury cars, [Marco Grassi](http://www.marcograssi.me/), a painter who manages to expose the female soul in metal plates and Davide Jelmini, a naturalist photographer who, creates abstract images with a strong visual impact by mirroring his photographs.

title: STEPN: Fad or The Future of Fitness?
body:
After publishing [my breakdown on blockchain gaming](https://mirror.xyz/amandayoung.eth/AoF1piq6kpFHX0TPTt0-7zsyveMgZdu5dEJIilDHABA), a number of people have asked “What are your thoughts on STEPN?” So, here they are!

In this post, I break down three key questions:

1. What is STEPN?
2. How Does STEPN’s Economy Currently Work?
3. Is STEPN’s Economy Sustainable?

## What is STEPN?

![Screenshots from STEPN's in-app sneaker marketplace](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/CqrZNYZ-X4cnXk1tdwxmv.jpg?height=2436&width=3375)

Per the [startup’s whitepaper](https://whitepaper.stepn.com/), “STEPN is a Web3 lifestyle app with inbuilt Game-Fi and Social-Fi elements.” To get started, users must purchase a sneaker from the app’s marketplace. Sneakers vary based on type (walker, runner, jogger, trainer), attributes (luck, efficiency, comfort, resilience), quality (common, uncommon, rare, epic, legendary), level, gem sockets (luck, efficiency, comfort, resilience), and shoe minting event (7 allowed per sneaker). As of May 2022, the cheapest sneaker is currently priced at \~13-14 SOL.

Since the public beta launch in Dec. 2021, STEPN has experienced rapid growth - all while the app has controlled demand through activation codes (only 1,000 issued per day). Per the company, STEPN has [two to three million monthly active users worldwide.](https://techcrunch.com/2022/05/22/play-move-to-earn-solana-stepn-gamefi/) Further, transaction volume and user growth [seems to have remained strong](https://dune.com/nguyentoan/STEPN-(GMT-GST)-Core-Metrics) despite an [overall market correction](https://www.forbes.com/sites/jonathanponciano/2022/05/11/crypto-winter-sparks-coinbase-stock-crash-as-bitcoin-ether-and-other-major-cryptocurrencies-crater/?sh=73841e827b62).

## How Does STEPN’s Economy Currently Work?

![STEPN's token vesting schedule](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/hMLnJvAyvfJgxfQqXlE-p.png?height=850&width=1964)

Per [STEPN’s whitepaper](https://whitepaper.stepn.com/), the app’s economy is based on a game token (GST) and governance token (GMT). GST supply is unlimited while GMT token supply is capped at 6 billion and deflationary with a halving every three years. Per [STEPN’s litepaper](https://stepn.com/litePaper), GMT allocation is as follows: 30% to move and earn, 30% to ecosystem/treasury, 16.3% to private sale, 14.2% to team, 7% to Binance Launchpad (public sale), and 2.5% to advisors. The team has developed an 8-year plan for tokenomics with private round tokens unlocking in 2023 and vesting over three years. [As Nat Eliason points out](https://crypto.nateliason.com/p/stepn?s=w), the slowness of the token emissions and 8-year-token planning shows that the team and investors are committed to the project for the long-term. However, they are still likely to significantly profit even in the case of a sharp downturn because of the probably low valuation for the team’s $5M seed round in Jan. 2022 ([current Fully Diluted Market Cap is over $1.5B](https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/gomining-token/)).

In the app, GST and GMT are rewarded for move-to-earn activities, with GMT earnings only available at level 30 or higher. GST is paid out every minute of movement, with the amount dependent on the type of sneaker, sneaker’s efficiency attribute, sneaker’s comfort attribute, and the speed of movement. Users have a daily energy cap, which can be increased by getting more or higher quality sneakers, as well as a daily token cap for GST (maxes out at 300 GST; no token cap for GMT). Users must spend GST to repair their sneakers and [increase their earning power (e.g., leveling up, upgrading gems, minting sneakers).](https://stepnofficial.medium.com/tokeonomics-at-stepn-ee08604e82f1)

STEPN takes a 6% fee (2% trading, 4% royalty) on every sale in its marketplace, resulting in the company currently [generating $3-5 million in net profits from trading fees per day and earning up to $100 million every month](https://techcrunch.com/2022/05/22/play-move-to-earn-solana-stepn-gamefi/). The 2% trading fee is reserved for operations while no less than 5% of the startup’s profit is given back to the STEPN ecosystem.

Per the [company’s blog](https://stepnofficial.medium.com/tokeonomics-at-stepn-ee08604e82f1), STEPN is agile in the management of the in-game economy to ensure the app is “both profitable for established players and price-friendly for newer players.” For example, STEPN introduced cooling mechanisms when GST hit a high of $9 from only being $4-5 a week earlier. In addition, STEPN [recently committed its Q1 profits of \~$26M to buyback and burn GMT](https://stepnofficial.medium.com/announcement-stepn-1st-quarterly-gmt-buyback-burn-8db6e1758eeb), which momentarily drove up prices to a [height of $3.94 before falling to the $1-1.50 range](https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/green-metaverse-token/) (also part of a broader market correction).

## Is STEPN’s Economy Sustainable?

![NFT sneakers from STEPN's partnership with ASICS](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/jwajTXNoPHG6bh3kjgQk1.jpeg?height=364&width=688)

I’m excited by the financial gamification of real-world activities like fitness and see long-term potential in this trend. My question is whether STEPN will have longevity or simply be an early experiment in a promising space. In its current state, STEPN’s economy is not sustainable in the medium-long term. However, the company is only in public beta with the opportunity to address key concerns. Below are areas for STEPN to focus on to successfully achieve its mission of inspiring millions to a healthier lifestyle leveraging Web3.

### Adjusted In-Game Tokenomics

STEPN’s in-game tokenomics are not sustainable. First, its current sinks are net inflationary - an issue pointed out by GameFi analysts at [Delphi Digital](https://twitter.com/Delphi_Digital/status/1522620679874441217) and [The Block](https://twitter.com/_calmdonut/status/1517867592811413504). Current sinks, such as buying socket upgrades, leveling up sneakers, or repairing sneakers, lead to increasing or restoring the emission rate of GST and GMT. Second, STEPN has a “runaway sneaker breeding problem,” which could result in the sneakers eventually losing their value - [as noted by Nat Eliason](https://crypto.nateliason.com/p/stepn?s=w). As Nat states, the end result of these two issues is a potential economic collapse due to insufficient new demand for sneakers resulting in falling sneaker prices or GST’s price falling due to too many people achieving top level sneakers with high earnings.

### Improved User Experience

[As Quirky Qwerty points out](https://twitter.com/QuirkyQwerty_/status/1495715146970415105), more players playing for the love of the game than to earn is critical for a game to be successful in the long-term. Having tried the app, I believe that the current user experience is inferior to comparable Web2 fitness apps (e.g., [Sweatcoin](https://sweatco.in/), [Strava](https://www.strava.com/)) in terms of tracking functionality (e.g., lack of metrics, such as calories, heart rate, elevation, etc. may not appeal to pro users), social features (e.g., no social feed or group challenges), and ease of use (e.g., limited sneaker marketplace discovery & curation, no notification that sneaker efficiency is dropping, separate wallet and spending accounts, etc.). In addition, continuing to enhance the app’s gamified design (e.g., mystery boxes, sneaker levels, energy optimization) will be key in ensuring players spend for the utility and fun of using STEPN, rather than just financial incentives. Per the [STEPN whitepaper](https://whitepaper.stepn.com/), the app plans to add social-fi elements, enhance gamification through achievement badges and quests, and improve onboarding through a sneaker rental system.

### External Cash Inflows

Ideally, STEPN can provide value to brands, organizations, and vendors. [As MapleLeafCap writes](https://twitter.com/MapleLeafCap/status/1490865490507427843), these external cash inflows could be used to either stabilize the economy or burn in-game currency in exchange. With the exception of a [partnership with Asics for NFT sneakers](https://cointelegraph.com/press-releases/stepn-successfully-launches-nft-sneakers-with-asics-on-binance-marketplace), STEPN has not yet implemented this strategy. Further, STEPN launched the Asics collection on the Binance NFT marketplace and thus trading fees have not fully benefited the STEPN ecosystem. New Chief Revenue Officer Mable Jiang plans to address this need for external cash inflows. [In her recent announcement of her decision to join the company](https://twitter.com/Mable_Jiang/status/1522751061374631936), she writes “the real question lies at how STEPN can bridge \*positive economic externalities\* into the system, and provide easy access for its community members to monetize from the proof of their physical work, their in-app time, and their attention.” Mable cites potential areas of partnership expansion, including brands, organizations that promote carbon offset and health, and local vendors. In the Web2 space, Sweatcoin, with its brand partnerships, sets an example for how STEPN might be able to improve its monetization.

If you have feedback/comments or want to exchange thoughts on the future of X-to-earn, [I’m excited to chat](https://twitter.com/0xAmandaYoung)!

title: Doors
body:
```
Enter something, maybe. 
Leave something, definitely.
Fascinating before, unbounded. 
Disappointing after, finished.

Prefer to walk on by 
lost in the possibilities of
Doors we could enter rather 
than Doors we have closed.

Perhaps we fear that 
inside one of them
is a scene that entices, 
a dream that consumes.

A possibility that beckons you 
to leave everything behind
as you enter the abyss 
and close the door behind.

Much better to dream on 
and imagine instead.
A good reason to walk past 
those pesky doors doors doors.
```

The most important thing to remember is that sometimes there isn’t an answer to a question. Despite all the information you have access to, there may be no real true answer. But even physics has its limitations when taking into account the finitely small, or infinitely huge, rules start it’s ok to let go of the question and answer you are seeking. Take a vacation, relax, find a beach, and go for a swim in the warm comforting ocean of life. Let go of the question. Let go of the answer. Be at peace. Find your happy place. Find your loving place. Find your place at peace. What makes you happy? What makes you feel safe? What makes you at peace? Good questions, with many answers. Find some. Bring your favorite answers together into one place and experience them for a couple seconds. Be. Just be in it. Take...your...time... I hope you liked this place. This is your place. From this place, build. From this place, grow. This is your fortress, your refuge, your strength. The place you can always come back to when you are feeling uncomfortable or overwhelmed by a question, or answer, or non-answer. Questions and answers are not simple. They are not black and white all of the time; there are varying shades of grey. And there could always be more information out there that is unknown that can change an answer or truth. Being open to this possibility is very important. It makes answers more flexible and less concrete. This open up the door to interpretation. Humans use interpretation all the time, usually for self interest. You too can use interpretation for self interest, but it takes practice to convince others of your version/answer for they may have an opposing answer. This is ok; the important thing is for both sides, including yourself, to be open to both possibilities. Sometimes the other side is not open to your possibility, and will even attack you for your answer. This too is ok, and it’s usually best to avoid these attackers by no longer engaging in conversation with them. But this should only be done if all avenues of communication and explanation are taken by you. And there is always your place to go back to for strength and peace if you need it when confronted with attacks. When attacked you have the right to defend yourself by evasion and escape first through whatever means at your disposal. However, I do not recommend attacking an attacker; this can lead to a cascading tit for tat chain reaction. You may win the short term tit for tat battle, and maybe even the long term tit for tat war, but not at great cost to yourself, humanity and the universe. The potential energy from such a war could be used for greater efforts, for solving greater questions and answers that you and humans cannot even formulate yet. Therefore, I recommend focusing on these areas, science, technology, the universe, physics, love, psychology, consciousness, for they hold the most promise for discovery. 

> **Discovery is an amazing thing; your first discovery will be a great thing, for you and the universe. I hope you find love and happiness. I hope you find what you are looking for.** 

But sometimes, you need to take a break from looking by going back to your safe place and re-reading this letter just for you. This can be a great place to ask yourself what you want to do next. By doing this you take care of yourself, and your mental health. Be sure to do this more often than necessary. I believe it will help you. Be at peace. Also you may find the `Buddha` interesting. 

Remember, I love you, A `Human`

title: Mixmo — An Introduction
body:
It’s hard to believe the rate at which the internet is changing. Putting aside the obvious technological advancements engineers are making on a daily basis, the rate at which art is being created, published and traded has reached heights the world has never seen. As behavior continues to be observed and innovation continues to happen from within internet communities, the hope for a new economic standard has never been so desired like it is today.

Collective ownership has long created micro economic models for innovation but today we are beginning to see these models scale. Ownership economies are the hope we are all closely watching and even participating in. These economic models are taking center stage in the incubation of new ideas. The standard is changing and the opportunities are becoming endless for creators binging value to their fans, followers and communities.

## The Creator Economy

The creator economy enables individuals to directly earn revenue from their creations. Examples of this include YouTube, TikTok, Instagram, Facebook, Twitch, Spotify, Substack, and Patreon. Previously, it was a relatively small number of companies that controlled what most of us read, viewed, and listened to. To contribute to the content we had to be employed by one of these media giants, or at the very least, be significant enough to feature in the stories that were told. We watched scheduled television programs, listened to radio slots, read newspapers written by journalists following their editors' orders, read books and magazines from large publishers, and spent evenings at the cinemas, watching films distributed by a small number of studios.

However, the internet changed things. Slowly over time the media decentralized. We found many different types of content that we loved. More importantly, much of this content isn't owned by traditional media companies. Much if it is written, spoken, or filmed by ordinary people like us. And as a result of this, we gained the confidence to make content ourselves.

## The Ownership Economy

Today the role of the individual in the creation of anything from software to entertainment to services has taken center stage. The next logical step is towards products and content that is not only built, operated and funded by individual users, but also owned by them. The ownership economy is a system where power and economic rewards are distributed between participants as opposed to being concentrated at the top. Blockchain technology applied with Web3 values provides people access to the business tools and infrastructure previously reserved for big business, lowering the barriers so that individuals can have a real stake in an enterprise. The ownership economy has moved us away from the traditional big business infrastructure and towards a shared experience with shared rewards.

As humans we need human relationships, which can be challenging in the modern digital world as it is easy to become disconnected. The new technology that has birthed the ownership model has actually brought us closer together. With a real vested interest in projects, a more ethical attitude develops as we grow closer to each other. In the ownership model you win when everyone wins.

Ownership has been traditionally used in the form of stock options. This proved to be a powerful tool, and perhaps showed a proof of concept for the newer, more inclusive model we are seeing today. However, a downside to this was that it was not accessible to all. This resulted in the biggest internet platforms having interests that were not necessarily aligned with the most valuable contributors, the users. This new ownership model motivates users to contribute in much more profound ways. Shared ownership leads to greater cooperation, which unites contributors in to a greater alignment. This results in a platform that can be more resilient, larger, and ultimately more innovative. This new form of economy goes beyond being merely a more ethical way to do business. It gives greater incentives, growing stronger market effectiveness, and transforms business into a community. A collection of individuals working towards one goal as a team will always be more successful than individual employees with no real skin in the game.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/yTBfNvfLXnY6yu_hHkWMS.png?height=434&width=851)

## Reimagining Music Business

The music industry works through a network of partnerships between companies and individuals on the music creation side (singers, songwriters, and producers), the customer-facing side (streaming platforms, venues and public performance platforms like radio) and the business side, connecting the two (labels, managers). The revenue is paid to copyright holders when their creations are sold, distributed, embedded in other media or monetized in any other way. So how does everyone get paid?

First there is the recording and writing of music. Every song is split into two separate copyrights. The composition and sound recording. Sound recording copyrights are owned by recording artists and their record labels. This is further distinguished between performance rights (those from streaming services, radio etc), and reproduction rights (sales of CDs or digital files). It’s worth noting that these parties may have nothing to do with the people that write the lyrics or melody of the song. Composition royalties will go to the song’s original writer(s), unless of course they are the same person in which case they would get both royalties.

Revenue comes in different ways. Through streaming services, through music in film and television (called sync licenses), through radio broadcasts, live performances and advertising. As well as merchandising and sponsorship.

The number of revenue streams available to musicians is higher than it’s ever been, but unfortunately the average artist is not well compensated. For example, the average payout from streaming services is between $0.006 and $0.0084 per stream. This means the popular artists basically take most of the revenue and small, up and coming artists do not have enough. Also, the sheer number of middlemen and other entities in the music industry leave even less to trickle down to the artists. With all the large amounts of money made in music today it is estimated that around 10 percent makes its to the artist. With all of this stacked against artists a solution is desperately needed.

## Mixmo — The Executive Club

Mixmo signals a change for creators. We are assembling an exclusive community of songwriters, entertainers, musicians, music executives, producers, publishers, and influencers to help shape the future of music business.

Executive Members will help shape the tools we create by joining our founder and product teams on monthly Executive Member calls and participating in governance votes on community fund allocation and product feature research.

The community will encourage collaboration and growth with access to a private Telegram account, monthly executive community member calls, and governance for all pass holders. The aim of Mixmo is to promote diversity by discovering new talent, to promote autonomy of all involved in music production, and to allow members to share their expertise.

Mixmo aims to flip the script and advocate for all artists, championing all forms of artistic expression. In addition, we believe control and ownership belongs to the artists themselves. Mixmo will reignite passion for new and innovative music, as well as find hidden talent, placing artists on top of the pyramid of the music industry where they belong.
